reviews: Bottle from Rabbit Hash General, drunk in Palmyra. Dark red brown, big pretty head. Complex roasted nose that reminds me of pecan fudge; plum/prune. Giant caramel flavor, butterscotch fudge, big bitterness balancing the sweetness. I love the complexity. Very good balance for such a heavy eight percenter!
Mooie scotch ale. Deze is wat minder zoet dan de meeste, maar heeft wel viscositeit. Prima body van melkchocolade, kandij, wat koffie, hop voor een diepere bitterheid, gedroogde vijg.

zapach przyjemny, słodki, ciężki, wertersy, praliny, słodki karmel, jasna melasa, spieczona skórka z drożdżówki, makowiec, krówka, w tle słodkie i kwaskowe czerwone owoce. okrągły, złożony. kolor miedziany, lekko opalizujący, piana beżowa, drobna, ogfita, dość trwała jak na styl. w smaku pełne, ciężkie, karmel, spieczony chleb, masa ziół, ziemia, tytoń, praliny, drewno, trochę przypalonego drewna, torf, czarna herbata, w tle alkohol, cierpki i wytrawny, ale przyjemny. całość dobrze zgrana, okrągła i lepka, ciężka, ale nie męcząca. goryczka wysoka, karmelowa, ziołowa, alkoholowa, długa, ściągająca, bardzo dobrze kontruje słodowość. nasycenie wysokie.
Alone at home. Brown colored beer brownish head and lots of carbonation. Malty chocolate coffee aroma. Full sparkling palate.  Finish is malty coffee alcoholic bitter sweet.

Colore marrone scuro, schiuma nocciola, media compatta. Al naso aromi di malto, caramello, note affumicate. Al palato note di malto, nocciola e liquirizia, il gusto è mediamente dolce, il finale è leggermente terroso e secco. Il gusto è dolce, Una birra molto armonica e pulita in cui il dolce ed il secco sono ben equilibrati, l'alcol si percepisce ma comunque rimane molto bevibile.

thuis een donker bruin kleurig lichaam met een wit bruinige kop en met een geroosterde mout donker fruit karamel aroma een geroosterde mout donker fruit koffie karamel droge bitter smaak met een alcoholische bitter einde

Dark brown colour, perhaps with some haziness though it's a hard to tell in a dark beer. At most one and a half finger of dark greyish/light brownish head, which soon recedes to a thin layer but still leaves nice lacing. Nice malty depth in a quite vivid aroma: toffee and caramel, plus light nuttiness and a hint of espresso coffee. Some dark or red fruit notes in the background. All among a nice warming feel. Taste notes more or less follow the aroma, though in not so nitid kind of way: the malty sweetness feels more 'generic' and is followed by a nice smoky/peated note. There's a nice warming feel as the smell suggested and lightly (pleasantly) perceptible alcohol. It's a very sweet beer but there's also a good amount of bitterness to bring balance, with a sweet edge in the mouth and a balanced finish that shows a hint of earthiness. Medium to dense in body with quite light carbonation, resulting in a nice half creamy, half smooth mouthfeel. A very nice one.

Ambrata scura, limpida, schiuma color nocciola, persistente. Al naso note di caramello, nocciola, dattero ma anche qualche nota ossidata (carruba). Al palato leggermente meglio. Corpo medio, secca, carbonazione fine.
Pours a beautiful deep mahogany color, with a good amount of off-white/yellow foam. Aroma is sweet and malty with some hops and maybe dark fruit. Taste is more of the same. Good stuff.

Malty aroma, reddish brown color.  Taste is a complex balance of thick malt sweetness, caramel, burnt wood, and floral/earthy hop bitterness at the end.  Lingering woody aftertaste.  Excellent example of the style.

355ml bottle (bottled 18/01/21) from Jumbo supermarket in Stein, Nethelands.
F: medium, tanned, good retention.
C: brown, hazy.
A: rich malty, fruity, herbal, berries, caramel, peat, toast, bit chocolate, dried fruits, spicy.
T: full malty base, caramel, herbal, spicy, peat touch, toast, red berries, dried fruits, dry on the palate, medium carbonation, very good balanced, fully enjoyed.

Bottle from Dranken Verheyen in Poppel, Belgium. 
The beer is hazy dark brown colored with a stable creamy head. Carbonation is good. 
The aroma is malts, caramel, dried fruits, vanilla, chocolate, cacao and spices. 
The taste is medium to full bodied and sweet malty with caramel, plums, dried fruits, vanilla and goes to bitterness with chocolate, cacao, yeast and spices. 
The finish is dry, bitter with long staying chocolate.
Sweet licorice, anis, Sweet licorice, anis, vanilla-bourbon touch. Drying-seert finish on touch. Drying-sweert finish.
Flesje thuis gedronken. Donker roodbruin bier met matig schuim dat snel weg trekt. Aroma van chocolade en vanille. Smaak van gebrande mout en pruimen. Nasmaak rokerig en bitter.
Very nice malty and yeast driven been. It’s actually not so chewy or big, yet it has loads of complex estery flavours. Great balance. Sterk ams
Brown body, thin white head. Whisky, caramel, a bit of fruits and nuts. A bit malty, light bitterness at the end.

Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass; from the fridge. Drinked @home.

We're in front of a light brown beer, lightly clear with a beige head. Good carbonation.
Aroma, and first taste, are a mix of milk chocolate and barley. Alcoholic aftertaste, but sweet.

Good.
Founders Dirty Bastard Scotch Ale 8.5%. Deep ruby, toffee and whisky aroma, full bodied, dark malt, dark fruit, whisky, peat, smoky, complex flavours. Stunning Heavy from Grand Rapids, Michigan 🇺🇸

Bottle from Hop Shop 
Pours with a vast head that hangs around Colour is deep dark ruby. 
Aromas: dark fruits, a whiff of whiskey, toffee apple? 
Carbonation is pretty soft, medium body. Nice warmth from the alcohol but blended really well. The resinous sweetness is very nice, without being at all sickly. 
Very enjoyable brew.
Donkerbruin bier met mooie stevige schuimkraag. Smaak is licht bitterzoet met iets van karamel, wat geroosterd brood en toffee. Heel erg goed.

En nariz, afrutada y maltosa. Se la ve caer en vaso con un color marrón oscuro, casi negro, con más de medio dedo de espuma uniforme, de tono granate. Es untuosa, sólida, con personalidad.
En boca presenta tonos semejantes al licor, poderosa, fuerte y contundente. De trago fácil, pero corto, para no excedernos por la presencia de alcohol y saborear también la probable presencia de frutas oscuras, de hueso.
No es mi Scotch favorita, pero es una muy buena opción.
Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, roasted malt, and dark red fruits. Perhaps some cinnamon. Taste of follows the nose. This is a full bodied brew and is well balanced.

Opaque copper-mahogany colour .... rich , toasty malt , syrupy aroma ... very bitter  , very tart , rich malt , full bodied ... great sipping beer ... delicious , well balanced , big , bold & sharp : Terrific !
Clean ruby brown colour. Malty caramel aroma. Caramel and cherry flavour. Hoppy bitterness as aftertaste.

Belle robe brune accompagnée d'une belle mousse blanche dense et épaisse.
Senteurs de réglisse, de pruneaux et de kirsch aux notes herbacées et pimentées.
D'entrée, la première gorgée fait office de coup d'estoc, arômes amples et denses : se mêlent la réglisse, le pruneau, le kirsch, la prune, le caramel pour un final accrocheur, puissant d'alcool fort mais gouleyant.
De beaux accents poivrés font leurs apparitions en seconde bouche, l'ensemble est liquoreux et complexe en bouche, c'est fin, caractéristique de la brasserie Founders qui nous gratifie décidemment de bien belles productions à son catalogue.
On se plaît à laisser le breuvage macérer en bouche pour notre plus grand plaisir, et on sait que l'on a affaire à une grande réussite et les 8,5 degrés tempèrent toutefois nos ardeurs.
Merci Founders pour ce petit bijou !!

Bevuta in bottiglia da 33.
Aroma di cioccolato tostato alle olive.
Schiuma a pezzettoni, colore rosso scuro quasi brunito o bruno. 
Gusto tostato forse troppo ma il giusto. Cioccolato, caffè e forse liquirizia.
CfgpPr
I go for this one fairly often. Opaque brown color and creamy head. Dark malts and fruit, burnt bread, cocoa, an effervescent bitterness. Boozy and warming in the winter.
Perhaps my first scotch ale in ten years and second ever. Smooth, dark, heavy, alcoholic. To retry.

Well when you’re craving a solid scotch ale, this standard-setting flagship brew from Founders does not disappoint. From the bottle into a snifter, this poured a rich, faintly murky, mohagony brown, par for the style but in a bolder way. The aroma is the only aspect of this beer that struck me as somewhat understated, with notes of burnt caramel / toffee and red fruit. The flavor is an excellent display of malty complexity, and finishes nicely with a touch of smoke and a clean-finishing hop bitterness. Overall very smooth, although the booziness becomes more apparent as this beer warms. Calls to minds alcohol-soaked raisins, not that I’ve ever tried that. Warming, hearty, well-executed. Worthy of its reputation. “Par for the style, but in a bolder way.”

I poured it from the bottle into a tulip glass.  It pours a mahogany with a beige head and lacing.  The aroma is caramel, nut, alcohol, and earthiness.  The taste is molasses, earthy hops, nut, and alcohol.  I usually don't love this style.  This one might convince me otherwise.  It does pack some punch.  It's very tasty though.  It's another solid offering from Founders.

Eingetrübte bräunliche Farbe mit beiger Schaumkrone. Malziger, röstmalziger, fruchtiger Geruch. Geschmacklich malzig, röstmalzig mit Kaffee, Toffee und dunklen Früchten, leicht hopfig. Mittlere Süße mit leichter Bitterkeit, mittlerer Körper mit spürbarer Kohlensäure.

355 ml bottle. Unclear mahogany brown, small beige head. Earthy notes, smoke, toffee, pine, dry grapefruit notes, spicy hops, burnt sugar. Dry hoppy bitterness, malty sweetness. Full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonated, dry bittersweet finish. Really hoppy, malty and very balanced!
Fantastic ticks all the boxes scotch ale. Great head and mouthfeel. Very malty and fruity. Full of flavour. Fantastic one to try and source again.

Hazy, copper brown with hint of red. Very little head that dissipates quickly. Plum, dried fruit aroma, slight maple. Chewy malty body with warming alcohol on tongue. Biscuit, plum, slight cherry flavor. Hint of oak and light smoke on finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from 12 oz bottle into tulip glass. A 1" tan head settles slowly with mild lacing. Color is color. Aroma of coffee, rich roasted malt, yeast rolls, hops. Mouthfeel is heavy with a slowly drying finish. Flavors of smoky, earthy malt, coffee, raisin, strong hop presence in middle and finish. Overall: excellent.
Thick tan foam. Amber ale. Sweet flavor  of oak, horhound, and scotch. Dates and oak finish.

Colore rosso rubino; schiuma beige, a grana molto fine, abbondante e abbastanza persistente.
Al naso prugna.
In bocca sapore prima dolciastro poi acidulo, prugna, amarena, caffè.
Carbonazione leggera, corpo medio.

Robe brune très intense. Mousse ivoire dense qui reste bien dans le verre . Fines bulles nombreuses. 
Nez sur le chocolat au lait, le caramel , le sucre brun , les fruits confits notamment des fruits rouges, des touches d alcool chaud . 
On retrouve les mêmes touches que au nez , avec principalement une petite amertume qui apporte de la fraîcheur . Des notes d épices , et poivré dans un second temps . Et une fin de bouche plus alcoolisé notamment quand la bière se réchauffe. 
Texture liquoreuse , final sucré .
Très complexe , on redécouvre des notes à chaque gorgé et quand la bière se réchauffe.

355ml bottle brewed in Michigan at 8.5%. As-good-as-black ruby, with a wee off-ivory head, OK duration. Classic aroma, sultanas, raisins, chestnuts, chocolate cake, smoke, black cherry and booze. I do love a Scotch Ale now and again. Low carbonation, slick easy mouthfeel. Chocolate, toffee, toasty malt, very light smoke, sultana, dry slightly sticky finish. Some fruity coffee in the aftertaste. Legendary Scotch Ale, alas not brewed in Scotland, but a flag-bearer for the style. This bottle just shy of two years old, and aged nicely.

Color marrón oscuro, con reflejos rojizos, casi opaca. Espuma beige claro, amarillenta, de casi dos dedos de espesor y retención media. Aroma medio intenso, licor, madera, maltas tostadas, caramelo, frutas muy maduras como higos, plátano, manzana al horno, bizcocho "borracho" y pan tostado. Sabor medio intenso, madera, maltas tostadas, licor, pan negro, frutas desecadas, canela, final medio, dulzor frutal medio y ligero amargor y sequedad que acompaña hasta el posgusto, alcohol notable. Textura semioleosa. Carbonatación baja.

Maravilla que no me canso de oler y encontrar matices. La falta de cuerpo y el ligero exceso de alcohol forman parte del estilo.
Smoother version of Sam Adams, less hoppy; good drinking, like but not favorite

30cl van de tap bij De Boterhal, Breda
Alcoholpercentage van 8,5%
Uitgetapt in Boterhal glas

Uiterlijk: koperbruin met goede vaste crèmekleurige schuimkraag 

Aroma en smaak: aroma zoete mouten, zoet rijp fruit, smaak is karamel, snoepjes, rijp fruit, licht gebrand bittertje
Brun/röd klar med smutsvit skum. Doftar och smakar russin och torkad frukt. Bra sötma och beska
Mitja carbonatació, bona retenció. Aromes a prunes, caramel... Maltosa i complexa. Clàssic de Founders, de les primeres cerveses seves...!
Bottle at home. Deep reddish colour with some beige lacing. Nose is lightly roasted,  dried fruity. Taste is low sweetness some bitterness, surprisigy thin body. Fast finish. Was expecting more.
Pours brown to copper, large frothy tan head, lacing, sweet-caramel coffee flavor with a lingering semi-bitter finish. Low carbonation.

Très belle robe brune, avec quelques reflets rougeâtres. Mousse inexistante.
Nez malté et torréfié. 
En bouche on confirme les arômes du nez avec un superbe soyeux. 
Une scotch parfaitement équilibrée, à recommander  sans hésitation !

Pours a dark reddish brown with a tan head. Aroma is slightly woody, some spice, raisin, caramel. Taste is a gathering sweetness growing into a sweet caramel middle, changing into a rather bitter finish that lingers for a good while. Medium bodied, medium to low carbonation. Really good.
Nose is sweet, caramel, butter. Palate is slightly bitter, brown sugar, coffee and caramel. Ok Scotch Ale
Restrained malt aroma in a deep red brown pour.  Rich preserved fruit body with a perfectly balanced bitter finish.

Aroma di frutti scuri, malto tostato spezie e caramello.
In bocca sentori marcati di frutti scuri caramello e spezie. Retrogusto alcolico e speziato.

Birra dal colore ambrato carico con riflessi rubino, schiuma  beige presente, abbastanza limpida, aromi di biscotto, caramello, datteri, fichi, pere, legno barrique, al palato tendenzialmente dolce e leggermente acidula, corpo pieno e leggera carbonaziona. Da provare

color: negro, espuma tostada persistencia media
olor: alcohol, dulce.
sabor: alcohol y amargor medio, compleja, cafe.
Bottle. Pours deep brown. Caramel, biscuit, earth, savory bakery products, dried fruit. Medium body. Decent.
Bottle from Varsity.  Not a full review - good dark red color and thick head.  Malt and peat - solid if a little heavy-handedly 'Scottish'. But packs a punch with that ABV.

Bottle, 0.355l. Deep amber pour, thin soapy off-white head, short lasting. Minimal lacing on the glass. Nose is heavy on the malt, strong caramel and sugary notes, quite intense, slightly toasted. Hints of liquor. 

Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Creamy texture, thick and chewy, very soft mouthfeel, mild prickly. Sweet taste with subtle alcohol bitterness. Aroma of toasted caramel, toffee, brown sugar, molasses. Syrupy, nutty. Subtle herbal spiciness. Liquory, rum notes, nicely warming, alcohol slowly builds up toward the finish, gentle burn on the tongue. Nicely balanced. Medium lasting finish.

Quite tasty.

From a bottle to a glass. Pours a clear darker copper color with a massive off white frothy creamy head. Aroma is sweet malts upfront honey brown sugar and slight darker fruits. Taste follows the aroma with hints of spice hops and molasses, mocha, caramel in the sip. Medium mouthfeel. Awesome Ale!

Nose. caramel, burnt sugar, sweet fruits a little rum.
Taste. Lusciously sweet, Russian candy "Barberry"
Did not like..

Bottle 33cl. @home poured into a teku glass. Slightly hazy deep amber brown, small frothy tan head, mostly diminishing, light lacing. Rich and strong aroma, roasted malt, caramel, candy sugar, dried dark fruits, treacle, ripe plum, alcohol. Taste light heavy sweet and light (malty) bitterness, roasty, candy sugar, caramel, treacle, light chocolate, alcohol. Full-bodied, oily to sticking texture, soft carbonation, smooth bittersweet finish with warming-alcohol, certainly not oversweet, good balance, but be careful this is heavy stuff, well-made, a real sipper, excellent.

Robe brune, trouble, un peu de dépôt. Mousse beige, faible tenue. Arômes biscuits, cassonade, épices, fruits secs, fruits à coques, fruits noirs, un peu d'esters. Goût très sucré, amertume très faible. Texture sirupeuse. Carbonatation très fine, peu abondante. 

Pour une scotch, ça manque de fumé.
Ho fatto fatica a finire la bottiglia, estremamente luppolata tanto da risultare stucchevole
Dark ruby pour. Earthy, bready malty tones as well as in the nose. Sweet yet slightly bitter

Pours clear reddened brown.  Off-white head with small bubbles.  Mild lacing.  Deeply earthy, almost skunky aroma.  Taste fronts bitterness.  Earthy hops tempered with bready malts.  Dry, caramel finish.  On the whole, too bitter for my taste.

Аромат немного сладкий как от ликера, намек на женную карамель и патоку, возможно легкие леденцы. Цвет темно красный, очень красивый, при этом пены слабая и тонкая. Вкус крепкого пива хоть и без особого алкоголя. Снова патока на первом плане, немного жжености. При глотке приятная хмелевая горчинка, причем весьма продолжительная. При согревание все таки есть алкоголь, но тоже не сильный. Ликерные нотки тоже на месте вместе со сладостью. В целом отличный скотч эль.

Liquide brun foncé, petite mousse. Nez alcoolisé, caramel, candi, fruits noirs. Bouche aigre mais aussi aux goûts de mélasse, de fruits noirs (griotte?), porto, sucre/sirop, quelques épices, du caramel. Petite amertume mais présence dominante d'alcool et de sucre qui enlève toutes nuances au produit. Une Founders qui me déçoit !

Ambrata scura ai limiti della “tonaca di frate” con riflessi rubino, velata e con lievito in sospensione, schiuma beige chiaro,compatta, grana irregolare e dalla buona resistenza. Al naso ricco bouquet di malti, leggera tostatura, caramello, melassa, punta di miele, crosta di pane, uvetta sotto spirito. Al palato l’inizio è dolce, zucchero di canna, malto, biscotto, suggestione di marmellata di frutta scura, datteri, fichi poi leggera affumicatura e note legnose, con finale ben luppolato su territori resinosi. Retrogusto etilico e amaricante al punto giusto e una punta di spezzatura. Corpo e carbonazione media.

Ruby red color when held to light thick tan foamy head smell of roasted malts chocolate taste is really smooth taste the roasted malts light chocolatey can taste bitterness in aftertaste cant taste alcohol great beer

Cette Dirty Bastard Scotch Ale est un brin ennuyeuse. Le genre n'est cependant ni le plus facile, ni mon favori. Le cocktail aromatique de caramel, de mélasse, pomme, poire, fraise et épices a du mal à nous faire nous emballer. Car sinon, celle-ci est plutôt bien structurée, et su le sucre est peut-être un peu trop présent, l'amertume, bien dosée (50 d’IBU) confère une bonne fraîcheur et l'alcool, à 8,5% soutient bien des arômes et donne un bon caractère (notamment sur la 3ème bouche). En verre nous sommes sur un cuivré opaque surmonté d'une mousse brune de 5 mm. Le nez se porte principalement sur le caramel, avec en complément de la pomme, fraise, poire et une pointe tourbée. Une texture agréable se laisse découvrir à l'attaque sur une bonne amertume mais des arômes quelque peu ennuyeux de caramel mélasse, pomme, poire, fraise avec une pointe de poivre. Ce cocktail nous suivra pendant toute la dégustation. La deuxième bouche est un peu plus profonde avec des épices se faisant davantage ressentir. Heureusement que l'amertume est toujours présente, permettant de donner de la fraîcheur à une base sucrée. L’arrière-bouche, linéaire est toutefois sur une bonne présence en bouche. En troisième bouche l'alcool se fait davantage ressentir donnant un bon caractère et laissant place à un final d'une bonne longueur mais plus doux. Peu passionnant.
pite jakiś czas temu. uzupełnienie profilu. Ocena przepisana z utpd. Miłego dnia.

En copa, cerveza marrón-rojiza muy oscura, con una fina capa de espuma color crema. Aroma dulce a cereales y caramelo, junto con mucho licor, madera de barrica, especias, regaliz, toffee, frutas oscuras, canela y un fondo ahumado. En boca, textura ligera y acuosa, de carbonatación baja y amargor muu suave. Sabor dulce a caramelo y cereales algo tostados, fruta madura, licor, regaliz, especias y canela. Una Scotch Ale intensa, tanto de sabor como de aroma, con una presencia marcada de alcohol. Totalmente recomendable.

I have drunk this beer, at home, in Prélaz, at september 2018, picking up this beer, at boitlegger, Paris. Personally, I had a great moment with this beer, getting a dark and powerful body, average carbination, white and brown foam. The tasty is really malty, bready with notes of sugar, toffee, cynamon, subtle notes of hop, perfect taste at the mouth.

Pours brown with beige head. Aroma of malt, bread, caramel, smoke, dark fruits, hint of brown sugar. Taste is big, malty, sweet, caramel, toasted bread, smoke, dark fruits come through in the finish, along with a slightly hoppy note.

Fles 33cl thuis. Heel licht rooksmaak, droog, noot, flink maltig, donker fruit, framboos, zoetig, bourbontonen, licht stroperig, hoptonen, ergens wat citrus, salmiak?, cinnamon, earthy. Complex. Goed. (17-11-2019).
Bottle 33cl. Pours deep dark amber. Medium malt, Roast, light dry fruit. Building bitterness, light sweet. The body is too light for the type. I drank better Founder's

Color marrón oscuro turbio con espuma fina beige de poca retención y residuo nulo. Aroma a madera, canela, pan tostado y caramelo con notas a tierra, bourbon y humo. Sabor a maltas tostadas, pan multicereales, caramelo, caramelo quemado, madera, canela y bourbon con notas a tierra, salsa barbacoa y ligera ceniza. Dulzor medio-alto, amargor medio y regusto largo. Textura semi-oleosa, cuerpo denso y carbonatación baja. Una Scotch Ale densa y dulce con toques ahumados y amaderados. Muy completa y bien redondeada.

12 oz. bottle.  AROMA:  Very sweet, with scents of brown sugar and caramel.  APPEARANCE:  Pours an opaque, dark brown with a very frothy tan head that dissipates slowly with nice lacing.  TASTE:  It tastes a lot like it smells, sweet with notes of caramel, and a bit of black coffee on the backend.  I don't really get any smoke or peat flavors, as the touted in the description.  MOUTHFEEL:  Has a nice, full body with a creamy-slick texture, and average carbonation.  OVERALL:  I like the style of beer, but this one is just a bit too much on the sweet side for me.  I think if it had more smoke, peat, or coffee flavor to offset the sweetness, then it would be more to my liking.  Having said that, I would never say "no thanks" if someone offered one to me.
Chestnut with light lasting tan head.Nose of toffee & malt. Pleasant sweet malt profile, hints of dark fruit.Medium hops and alcohol heat
Donker bruin bier met weinig schuim. Het bier smaakt sterk moutig en heeft ergens een licht rokerige smaak. Het bier eindigt hop bloemig en goed droog.

I expecting little more things and from this "American" beer but it's ok and still is a decent beer.. First of all the Aroma remind me some "Sierra Nevada" beers and that wasen't good sign to me but the taste was more on "Belgian" beers and that satisfied me.
The taste is very smooth and little watery in the beginning but the aftertaste is amazing and remind you "Belgium" beers like "Pauwel Kwak".. The aftertaste is the greatest thing on this beer for sure.. Is very easy drinkable and very smooth beer.. The body is medium and the mouthfeel average.. 
Overall one good bittersweet beer to drink in the winter with very good appearance and aftertaste.. I expecting something more from the good ratings but in the end i enjoy the beer..

From a bottle. Pours with little head. Very sweet and malty, with no discernible smokiness, despite the description. Quite drinkable and the ABV is well-hidden. A bit sweet for my taste buds. Good overall.
Weer een heel mooi bier van Founders. Uit een flesje. Diep rood, donkerbruin, mooi stevig schuim. Veel caramel in de geur, ook wat chocolade. Volle romige smaak, caramel. Heerlijk.

0.33 bottle
C: murky dirty brown
N: heavy cream, toffee, caramel
P: lots of toffee, sweet caramel, malty, mollases, creamy, lightly herbal, light liquorice, clean taste, earthy finish.

12 ounce bottle.  Pours a hazy, dark copper with   thine darker tan head.  Taste is of malt, caramel, scotch, fruit, toffee and smoke.  Similar aroma.  Has a decent body with a booze finish.  Overall, great.

Dark brown pour, long lasting, off-white head. Nose is rich malts, dried fruits, nuts, low booze. Taste is sweet notes of booze, malts, fruity touch, basically pretty much the same as the nose. Medium bodied with soft carbonation and long sweet finish. Simple, but pretty tasty.
Sabor a chcolate y café, cuerpo robusto, color rojo oscuro, espuma baja. No se siente el 8.5% de alcohol, puede acompañarse de un buen postre

330ml bottle @home. Bruna intensa, limpida, schiuma avorio/senape media, discretamente persistente. Al naso note di caramello, datteri secchi, toffee, liquirizia, leggero affumicato. In bocca è dolce all'attacco, rotonda, calda e corposa, con chiusura amara ad equilibrare. Veramente ottima!
Dark cloudy amber color with a medium-sized beige head. Toffee and malts aroma. Creamy body texture with a light bitterness in the aftertaste.

Dark brown colour with nice beige head. Sweet aroma of toffee, banana bread, cinnamon and licorice. Mild sweet taste, flavors of bread, smoked malts and liquor. Medium body, creamy texture, bitter aftertaste, a bit of astringency at the end. Strong malty ale, stunning.

Aroma:  lots of toffee, caramel, 
Appearance: hazy dark reddish-brown color with a one-finger brown head.
Taste: lots of toffee and caramel, ripe cherry cake, high sweetness, medium-low bitterness
Palate: full body, low carbonation, sweet and very low bitter finish, very low alcohol sensation
Overall: highly malty, great scotch ale. Didn't find the smokiness as it mentioned.
Best sipping ale I have had. Nice ether and  strong flavor. Let it warm up, you will miss out if you drink this cold.

Aromas a caramelo y pasas
Aspecto bueno espuma cremosa y persistente
En boca cuerpo pleno maltosa y compleja final con regaliz y seco

The flavour only lasts as long as the sip, but the journey in between is sensational. I feel like Marty McFly coming back from the past; not much time has gone by since I was last here, but so much has happened.
Bottle. Pours copper with an off white head. Rich caramel malts and toast, mild-moderate sweetness, low bitterness, and a clean malty finish. Good stuff.

Fluffy light tan head stayed on a hazy reddish brown body.
Malt, berry, syrup & jam aroma.
Medium to full bodied, oily, greasy & smooth over the palate with a clean finish.
Berries, caramel, hoppy, resin, syrup & dried fruit tastes.
355 ml bootle. Grat elegant beer to experience, and almost perfect except dor the smell, but the first founders i've ever had was not a dissapointment

Brilliant ruby red color. No bite of alcohol despite the 8.5% ABV. Extremely well balanced with rich malts with caramel, subtle smokiness, some complex fruity notes (plum and strawberry), and ends bittersweet. Lovely beer from Founders!

Toń mahoniowa. Piana bardzo obfita, szybko opada do atolu.
Aromat starego drewna, bukwi, żołędzi, ciemnego pieczywa.
Ciało półpełne, średnio nasycone.
Smak ciemnego pieczywa, palonego karmelu, drewna. Goryczka średnio intensywna, chmielowa.
Wolałabym olda z mniejszą ilością razowca, psuje i tak średnie wrażenie.
Sample from bottle. Clear mahogany color with a thick, lasting beige head. Pretty pour, but… Very strong, alcohol-dominant flavor supported by dark fruit flavors. Very unenjoyable. Drain pour.

12 oz bottle. Pour is dark walnut in color. Aromas of caramel and toffee. Dried fruits on the palate along with a slight grain/biscuit taste. For a non smoked beer there are hints on the nose. Beer leaves a velvety texture on the palate with a sweet lingering finish. Well done lads. My first, and certainly not my last,

bottiglia 355 ml, schiuma fine pannosa cremosa beige persistente, color marrone/mogano, al naso intenso caramella mou caramello malto tostato legno, in bocca è vellutata malto caramella mou amaretto uvetta, carbonatazione leggera, corpo rotondo, dolce compensato da una buona luppolatura che gli conferisce un amaro accentuato lungo nel finale. Molto buona 26.04.19

Sample 12/9/16 (Binny's Montgomery) Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, roasted malt, and dark fruits. Taste of the same. This full bodied brew is well balanced and darn tasty.
Przyjemny zapach, cukierkowy, karmelowy, bardzo ładna piana, w smaku toffi, opiekany chleb.

Pours heavily carbonated brown with a very thick and active creme head. Aroma of earthy malt notes. Taste is malty with a nice bitter element on the end. Palate contains evergreen, whiskey, grain head on the nose. Not bad.
Very peaty, the Scotch in the name is definitely programme. Off white head, full ruby/brown colour. Full body, very mild carbonization. Not your everyday ale!

0,35l bottle. Pours brown with beige head. Aroma of malt, bread, caramel, smoke, dark fruits, hint of brown sugar. Taste is big, malty, sweet, caramel, toasted bread, smoke, dark fruits come through in the finish, along with a slightly hoppy note. Very good.

This is quality like all the other from Founders that I tried. Smooth caramel flavor with a good flatter/low carbonation feel.  A medium to darker brown appearance with mocha colored head. Only sampled a couple ounces in a flight, but this will be on my list to grab a 4-pack of.

Dark brown scotch style ale. Smells sweet, and of scotch, coffee, caramel, dark chocolate and dried fruit. Tastes of dark chocolate, roasted coffee, caramel and slight whisky overtones. A strong bold flavour.
Ar: caramel, malt Ap: dark brown, creamy head T: med malt sweetness, caramel, med bitterness P: med body

12 oz. bottle. Poured into a freezing pint glass. Couldn't fully discern the color or head due to the glass, but dark brown or "deep ruby" seems accurate.  A malt bomb that assaults the taste buds up front. Heavy malt aroma. Very deep, rich malt character, layered with a variety of smooth and dense flavors. Buttery, toffee and caramel. Faint smokiness. Sweet but not overpoweringly so. The recipe is well done, even balanced, by the 55 IBUs. At 8.5% it's highly sessionable. Very malt-dominant. Hop-heads may want to look elsewhere. Will drink again.

A 12 fl. oz. bottle, bottled on 4th October 2018. Poured into a snifter glass. It was a clear amber copper orange colour with a one finger tanned head that dissipated fairly quickly but left some nice lacing. Aromas were fruity, sweet artificial cherry, cotton candy, plum, prunes, light roast, chocolate and caramel. Tastes of roasted malts, lightly sweet, caramel, burnt sugar, smoke, light peat with a light lasting bitter finish. Medium bodied with moderate to soft carbonation. Overall wow, this was much better than expected and I enjoyed this even more than Backwoods Bastard, especially the aroma which impressed me.
Pours dark red, tan head. Aroma is roasted caramel, sweet, malt. Taste is caramel, nuts. Strong and very nice beer overall.
Overall, above average, but a bit nasty, I can see why some would love this beer!

12 ounce bottle into a pint glass. Poured dark black. Tan/khaki head. Good lacing. Tastes like chocolate and roasted coffee. My only complaint is the abv. Too strong for my liking at 9.5% Over all a very  good beer.

Aroma: Fruity sweet with prunes and caramel. 
Flavour: Fruity and malty sweet with fruity bitterness. Aftertaste is sweet and fairly bitter. 
Colour: Reddish brown with an offwhite head.

Birra americana del colosso FOUNDERS BREWING CO @foundersbrewing . Colore tonaca di frate con bei riflessi rossi, cappello di schiuma bello persistente con una grana mista e di un color nocciola chiaro. Al naso si percepisce il caramello su tutto, poi leggere note di inizio torrefazione di caffè, poco miele e note liquorose quasi di cherry. Al palato la birra è abbastanza dolce ma mai squilibrata, si hanno gusti di caramello, frutta secca (nocciole tostate e prugne) una puntina di liquirizia e un leggero amaro di radice che pulisce. Soltanto scaldandosi esce un po' l'alcool. Carbonazione medio bassa. Birra interessante, si lascia bere bene, soprattutto nelle fredde giornate invernali.

Pours a nice deep dark red. Aroma is malty, toffee. First sip is heavy malt forward, but backed up almost equally strongly with hop flavor and bitterness. The malt flavor is similar to the aroma with a toffee/caramel quality. Body is full, but the palate is bordering crisp, or at least as crisp as a brew this malt forward can seem Smoke lingers in the finish. At 8.5% abv this brew is not solely a sit by the fire sipper. I would refer to this one as a jacked up west coast scotch ale. N
Can from Systembolaget Sweden. Big and lastning brown head. Clear dark red brown color. Interesting nutty and  and light roasted malt aroma. Nutty caramell taste with a medium bitterness and body.
bottle. Amber brown, mid-sized off-white head. Dried fruit, raisins, dates, some shy chocolate on a sweetish malty base. Sm,ooth and velvety palate.

Deep copper red-brown color, golden brown head. Malty nose, toffee, dried fruit, raisins, prunes, hint of burnt sugar and bread. Toffee caramel taste, sweet malty, dried fruit, burnt sugar, well hidden alcohol, balanced. Medium body, soft carbonation. 

8, 4, 8, 4, 15

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Drinkhut, Uithoorn.
Dark brown with an off-white head. Dark caramel with roasted malts, dark fruits and some peaty smoke. Sweet taste with a sweet bitter finish. Reminds me heavily of a really strong doppelbock, which is a good thing.
12 oz bottle. Smells of malt and caramel. Brown in color. Tastes sweet, notes of caramel, bourbon, and a little warming. Sweet finish. Too sweet for my tastes.
Bursztynowe, mętne. Karmelowy, wyczuwalne palone słody. Posmak cierpki, mocno orzechowy.
Bottle. Sweetish, really mostly malty / hints of caramel. Moderate on alcohol feel and bit oily texture. Nice
Bottle. Malty aroma, caramel, light coke notes, burned sugar. Tastes the same as aroma, light to medium sweet and bitter. Medium to full body, malty bitter finish. Good.

Candy sugar molasses, and carmelizes fruit. Not my style, but love this beer. Daring and innovative, a scotch that manages to not be a sickly sweet desert, but a complex flavor bomb

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap, which a HUGE differrence in this beer. A Scotch ale that saved an entire brewery. Smooth, sweet and with almos a perfect balance. It demonstrates that not always a lot of lupulus is the solution.

Bought at Supermarket Liquors in Fort Collins. Bottled October 18th 2018.

Pours a dark reddish brown with an off white head of foam, nice lacing. 

Smells of burnt brown sugar, caramel malt, toffee. 

The taste is burnt brown sugar which gives it some bitterness, caramel malt brings the sweetness, toffee, maybe some vanilla, kind of toasty. 

Fairly light bodied with lightish carbonation, finish is decidedly burnt and bitter. 

Not much alcohol interference, still a sipper that I enjoy.
#1207 lahvová 355ml z pivotéky ve Frýdku-Místku. Můj první Scotch Ale. A mooc dobrý. Budu muset vyzkoušet další na porovnání.
Found in bottle from Ingles in Waynesville, NC. Appealing dark brown with thin white head. Well mixed throughout. Really good for the style and a great Fall option.

Excelente cerveja, encorpada forte, cor rubi escura, aroma de malte tostado levemente defumado. Espuma cremosa escuta e persistente. Sabor do malte tostado marcante na boca com bom amargor e retrogosto amadeirado.
A sensação de álcool na boca faz jus aos seus 8,5%.
Draught @ Darbys. Amber-brown with a thin head. Toffeeish malt on the nose, and the palate. Nice, mellow bitterness and some toasty malt accents to provide balance. Good stuff.

15.10.2018
Kolor ciemno bordowo brązowy, klarowny. Piana w konsystencji kremowa, sztywna, koloru beżowego. Bardzo ładnie maluje szkło.
W aromacie delikatna paloność, nuty owocowe, głównie ciemne owoce, w tle bardzo minimalne akcenty karmelowe.
Smak to ponownie lekka, tutaj kawowa paloność, dalej ciemne owoce, delikatnie kwaskowe i nuty popiołowe. Na finiszu popiołowa goryczka.
Alkohol dobrze ukryty, aż chciałoby się tu poczuć delikatne rozgrzewanie. Wysycenie średnie, ciało średnie, pasuje.
Ale mi to piwo smakowało.

07.08.2021
Kolor ciemno brązowy, klarowny. widoczne rubinowo brązowe refleksy. Piękna. wysoka piana w kolorze ecru. Zbudowana z drobnych pęcherzyków tworzy wysoką i niebywale trwałą pianę. Ładnie zdobi szkło znacząc każdy łyk spienionym pierścieniem.
W aromacie dominują nuty słodowe, słodkie. Jest skórka od chleba, kurz, trochę akcentów przyprawowych. Całość jest bardzo spójna.
Smak wytrawny z odrobiną słodyczy. Skojarzenia ze świeżym chlebem, ze spieczoną skórka od chleba są tu jak najbardziej na miejscu. 
Alkohol dobrze ukryty. Wysycenie średnie. Ciało pełne. Tekstura gładka. posmak długi, przypomina tosty, spieczony chleb.
Wygląd 4, Aromat 8, Smak 8, Podniebienie 4, Razem 18, Ocena: 4,2/5

Zapach: słód, miodowy, lekki karmel i ciemny chleb, trochę estrów w tle i przypalonego cukru. Smak: słodowy, trochę szlachetnego alkoholu, herbaciany, ciemne pieczywo, karmel, sprawia trochę wrażenie wodnistego i pustego w smaku, szczególnie przy tym 8,5% alko. Dla mnie średni wypust i moim zdaniem nie ma się tu czym podniecać :)
Draft - Malty caramel and toffee notes. Deep rich brown with a decent beige head. Rich, malty and some woody notes.

Smooth and satisfying like freshly brewed coffee on a cold Saturday morning.  More like a liqueur with its heady notes and the complexity of o delivery.  The longer you let it linger in the pallet the hits just never seem to stop coming.  Almost like a marching parade of molasses, coffee, chocolate, and bitterness. Without that bitter zap the drink would certainly be muddled in flavor.  But as it is, it is perfection.

Van 't vat. Donkerbruin bier met een rode gloed en ecru kleurig schuim. Geur: geroosterde mout, licht zoet, karamel, licht fruitig, gedroogd fruit, ietwat kruidig. Smaak: licht zoet, karamel, wat geroosterde moutbitterheid, wat gedroogd fruit, wat vijg, licht kruidig. Volmondig. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht bitterzoet met een lichte alcoholische gloed.

Bottle. Color: Dark ruby, beige head. Aroma: Sweetish, caramel, vanilla, smoky hints. Taste: Malty, burnt caramel, brown sugar notes, some vanilla. Subtle notes of smoke and peat. Hints of raisins and dark fruit like dates. Medium sweet and moderate to medium bitterness, somewhat more bitterness and bittery palate at the long lasting finish. Bit sticky. Above medium body, below average carbonation. Nice one.

Draft at The Abbot's Ale House, Cork, Ireland. Pours dark plum with practically no foam. Aroma is liquor-like, dry figs, burnt caramel. Body is fairly dense with moderate carbonation. Taste is intensely sweet with limited bitterness. Finish is fairly long and sweet.
Brown pour, minimal tan head. Almost citrusy aroma. Tastes like tea with a little bit of malt. Slight hops on the finish. Full mouthfeel.

355ml bottle, poured into Stone snifter.
A: Dark mahogany, opaque, an initial tanned head made a quick getaway, left a moderate amount lacing.
S: Cherry, caramel , toffee, molasses.
T: Followed the nose, made a good job of hiding the booze.
M: Not much in the way of carbonation, creamy texture, light body for the high abv.
O: Nice beer for the colder weather, a bit like Stone Arrogant Bastard on steroids.
Что-то расплывчатое фруктовое выпирает во всех стороны, забивая все. Даже уже классическую фаундеровскую спиртягу забило...

Scotch ale de 8,5 % abv et 50 ebu, qui fait partie du top 50 du style …
selon les votes d'une partie du public ...
Respect et attention .. mais pas de panique !!
Brassage avec 10 malts (!!???), mais il ne fallait pas mon pauvre ...
Mon exemplaire était exactement à sa date, comme pour insister !!
Couleur rousse des landes écossaises à l'automne.
Mousse beige marqué, crémeuse, stable à 3 mm.
Arômes distingué de noix de pécan, bruyère à l'automne, et miel de
bruyère .. comme pour le confirmer !!
1ère bouche très souple, avec cerises confites, miel de lavande.
Arrière-bouche très fine, fleurie et liquoreuse à la fois.
2ème avec un kirsch non fini, et une liqueur de cerise en cours de
fermentation.
Arrière-bouche peu engageante de cerise rouge un peu aigre.
3ème qui perd de la consistance et de l'à propos …
Arrière-bouche qui n'a rien de scotch .. foi de whisky man !!
Longueur qui déçoit plus qu'elle ne convainc .. mais je complique !!
Jambes fines, courtes, collantes.
Levure faible, oui, faible.
Alcool qui fait à peine son niveau, et ne casse pas une demi-lune …
Finale assez limite.
CONCLUSION : bastard .. eh oui, dirty … eh oui, donc pas un top 50 !!
Si vous cherchez un vrai scotch, prenez vos bagages et allez en Ecosse !!
NB … très largement surcoté, ma biche .. (6/3/3/2/5)

12oz bottle. Pours dark-amber-brown with a moderate beige head. Aroma is brown sugar, caramel, light chocolate, light plum, and a little peat. Taste is caramel, toffee, dried fruit, light brown sugar, very light peat, and a hint of wood. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Oily mouthfeel bordering on creamy.
A really high alcohol beer that comes off sweet It really delivers in what you would expect out of a Scotch ale.

Le 30/07/2018. Bouteille 35.5cl. Verre Saveur Bière 15cl. DDM : 03/08/2018.

Mousse : Beige, ½ doigt, s’estompe rapidement, bulles moyennes.
Robe : rubis marron foncé, trouble.
Nez : Boisé, cerises, malts, épices, caramel, alcool, whisky.
Bouche : Fruits rouges, boisé, fin longue sur l’amertume et assez sèche.
Palais : Faible carbonisation, fine bulle, huileux, un peu crémeux.

Bottle 0.355L.
Hazy dark amber-to-brown body with a large, frothy, tan head, mostly diminishing with some nice lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy malty (roasted, caramel) aroma with notes of dark fruits (prunes), raisins and light chocolate.
Moderate-to-heavy sweet and moderate bitter flavour; long-lasting complex finish with notes of bitter chocolate.
Medium-to-full body with oily texture; soft carbonation.
SB burk nångång. Fin julöl egentligen inget för denna helvetessommar.  Fin med ost. Fikon dadlar russin och lite choklad både i arom och smak. Founders alltid pålitliga.

Poured dark brown, almost black, from bottle. To me, it smelled almost barrel aged. Tasted similar, with some sweet malt aftertaste with a balanced amount of hops bite. Overall, a good beer. I’d have it again.

On bottle.
Scent: Christmas, cloves and anise.
Taste: Spiced, smoke, a bit alcoholic, sweet ending.
Texture: Nice co2 level.
Great tasting "Brown Ale" with some punch to it. Pours a clear amber brown color with a thick head. All that comes to mind is caramel and nuts. Deffinately worth a second buy.

Bouteille 35,5 cL, Saveur Bière, chez moi. Robe ambre/rubis sombre, mousse brune légère. Arômes de whisky et cerise. Texture huileuse (on sent qu'il y a du monde là dedans) et sucrée. Notes riches de caramel, cerise confite, épices, malts, fumé. Fin sèche sur les épices.

Bottled 0,355L. Dark brown color, hazy aspect, very bubbly and foamy head of long duration. Not much intence nose, notes of caramel, braced sugar, alcohol, soft burned wood. Round and fraught palate, notes of ashed caramel, wood, smoked malt, whiskey, sweet and oiled long final.

Ale del birrificio Founders. Gradazione 8,5. All'olfatto si presenta tostata, colore marrone scuro con buona schiuma. corposa il giusto lascia retrogusto amaro. Da provare era gli amanti del genere!!!

Bottle from Gedeelde Vreugde; bottled 17/8/18. Hazy dark brown, big, foamy, beige head. Warm and intense aroma of butterscotch, marmalade, dark honey, fudge, candied plum, date, sugared peanut, milk chocolate, cookie dough, coffee liqueur, triple sec, liquorice. Taste has sweet to very sweet prune, date, fig & pear; caramelly and marmalade-like maltiness with 'buttery' fudge and milk chocolate adding to the sweetness, hint of nuts toning it down a bit as well as a light toasty, herbal bitter edge. Ends herbal hoppy, nutty, very slightly toasty before caramel & candied fruits kick in again along a warming dash of liqueur alcohol. Full body, syrupy texture, soft carbonation. A superior malty Ale still, pure delight.

Original rating: 25 June 2018. 9/4/9/5/17=4.4.
Bottle at The Cat's Back, Tilburg. Shared with Anke.
Piwo wypite jakiś czas temu. Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji, w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.

6/29/18
With A the night before I️ have to head back north. 

Deep brown with a big, light brown head. Bottle is pretty cool too. 

Very malty nose. Lots of dark roastiness but definitely smells lighter than a big stout. Can maybe get some of the claimed “smoke” if I think about it. 

Taste is a malt bomb. Lots of caramel and bread. Some bready sweetness with more bitterness than expected. Similar to a doppelbock/big winter warmer but less spicy. Getting hat weird “blood” flavor again that I taste in some beers. Maybe this bottle is old? Got it from a variety 6 pack stand. 

Medium palate. Drinkable but big. 

Overall, not a bad beer at all but I’ve had similar tasting things that were better.

Twelve ounce bottle. Very impressive brew. "Scotch Ale" seems to be not efficient to describe this. How about "Heavy Scotch Ale". It is on that side of the dial. Like they say, Dark ruby in color and brewed with ten varieties of imported malts. Yes very malty, it bites, not a metallic bite, but almost. Do not make the mistake that I made of drinking one while taking a break from mowing on a very humid day. This is a winter beer.

Ciemnorubinowa barwa, ładna drobnopęcherzykowa piana redukująca się do obrączki, obfity lacing. Prezentacja pierwsza klasa. Równie wspaniały aromat, na pierwszym planie słodowość, melasa, cukier podpalany, jak w dobrym doppelbocku. Ale momentalnie doznania rozszerzają się o nuty waniliowe, mokrego drewna, trochę wina. Smak jest już mniej wielowarstwowy, raczej słodowy z nieco kwaśnawym finiszem. Bardzo dobre odczucie w ustach, piwo jest gładkie, nie lepkie ani nie wodnite. Dobre to, Founders nie zawodzi.

Pours a dark reddish brown. Rich taste, with a good, treacle flavour with notes of fruit, Demerara sugar and red fruit. Some hints of chocolate also. Delicious as mouth-filling.  A rich and satisfying Scotch Ale.
Can. Dark ruby colour, head does not stay long, fair lacing. Aroma is lots of sweets, strawberry, toffee, warming alcohol. High sweetness, slightly bitter. Good, but you need to like sweet beer.
Almost black with small beige head. Slight roasted aroma. Medium bitterness with roasted sweet-sour notes.

Poors deep cherrie red dark brown. Frothy, brown head, short lasting. Aroma red currant, distinctly fruity, like grenadine syrup even, light candi sugar, faint chocolate roasted malts, not too powerfull but fruity and clean. Taste candi sugar, some plums, red currant, light fruity hops, astringent hoppy MF. MF: medium thickness and soft. Not too powerfull tasting either but has great depth.

Aroma of roast biscuity malt; a beautiful dark reddish brown with an off white head. Tastes initially sweet, but with a pleasant bitter finish. What long Scottish (mid Western?) evenings were meant for!

Prima scotch ale provata. Non male, pur non essendo il mio genere. Odore decisamente piacevole e ricco, al palato e subito dolce e dopo amarognola con sentori vinosi. A fine sorso lo scotch si fa sentire. Buona per il genere, ma dopo mezzo bicchiere non mi ha invogliato molto a finirla.

Couleur rouge foncée/brune. Mousse correcte et relativement tenace. Nez au taquet sur le raisin sec, et un peu caramel en arrière-plan. En bouche le corps est plutôt moyen, en tout cas moins massif que ce à quoi l'on pourrait s'attendre pour une Scotch Ale. Bien entendu là aussi c'est full malté, mais avec des notes de caramel, de chocolat en dominant, avec une pointe de raisin sec et de noix en fin de bouche. Cette fin de bouche peut s'apparenter à la finale d'un American Barley Wine, ce qui peut laisser sous-entre la présence d'un houblonnage d'un fort beau gabarit. Sympa;

Rich and nutty dark ale with a big malt profile and a sweetness that is just the right side of overpowering. Chocolate and caramel aroma that comes through in the taste too. Bitter finish that stops it being cloying. Looks appealing too with a dark ruby body and thick off white head. Too strong to sink a few but  tempting as it tastes seriously good.

Botella de 33 cl adquirida en Gastrópolis, Zaragoza. Servida en copa de Founders a una temperatura de 8 grados aproximadamente. 
Precioso color rojo cobre, algo turbia. Espuma color café, un dedo. Persistencia media y poca retención. 
Aromas maltosos, algo ahumada, regaliz, ciruelas pasas y frutas negras.
En boca es equilibrada, apenas se nota el alcohol. Algo amarga. Se nota la malta tostada, cierto dulzor, pan tostado.

A little bit dark in color. Roasted nut finish. Would go great with 7 layer chocolate cake or a beef stew. Maybe red apples & cheese, not sure. Not an everyday beer for me, but more appealing with the proper pairing. Definitely not a session beer.

Very tasty ale, it's like a mix between a stout and a Belgian triple brown, like rochefort. Much sweeter and lighter than most stouts, it holds a mild and sweet tone of cinnamon and chocolate and some caramel flavour. Definitely digging this!
LCI. Uit de fles geschonken. Hele lekkere scotch ale, mooie balans van caramel, mout en bitter, niet te zoet. Prima!
Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 07.05.18. Excellent aroma of dried berries, malt, roasted nuts and dates. Fine taste of dates, dried berries, vintage plum jam, roasted almonds and chocolate.
Beautiful copper colour, almonds, fruitcake, but elegant balanced hops, chocolate. Very complex and rich.

caramel, bread, roasty, hay, cereal, chocolate, coffee, nuts, toast, pale, golden, amber, orange, red, brown, black, cloudy, sparkling, minimal head, white foam, tan foam, brown foam, rocky head, frothy,

Aroma plomme, sviske, mørk malt, karamell. Utseende mørk brun med beige skum som varer. Smak plomme, sviske, mørk malt, karamell, sjokolade, alkohol, lakris. Kraftig øl med noe alkoholsmak, saftig, smaksrik, lang og god ettersmak av plomme og lakris.  Boks fra Systembolaget Storheden, 35,5cl 8,5%

A great example of American Wee Heavy. Aroma is raisins and slightly sweet. Little hops but a great balance. Malt rich but not syrupy. Bitter and sweet are wonderfully balanced. Perfect for a cool night around the fire, haggis is optional!

Biscuits, caramel, toffee, dried fruits, herbs and toast in aroma. Pours ruby with off-white head. Taste is medium sweet with biscuits, caramel, prunes, raisins, herbs and toast. Medium to high bitter finish, average to lively carbonation, well hidden ABV. Overall pretty good, slightly overcarbonated.
Usually scotch ales are a little too sweet and syrupy but this one neither. It was surprisingly fantastic. Slight Carmel, toffee candy, with a medium mouthfeel. Anything founders makes is phenomenal.
Mörk rödbrun vätska med litet gulbeige skum. Doft av honung, söt malt, får lite whiskeyvibbar. Söt fyllig och len, vid smaken tillkommer även lite lakritstoner. Riktigt bra ale!

Aroma: Cereals and a caramel touch.
Appearance: Dark amber/color with clear liquid and beige head.
Taste: Light sourness with heavy bitter notes.
Palate: Full body with creamy texture and soft-average carbonation. Long bitter caramel finish.
Overall: Leaves a bitter and lightly smoky memory. Goes with fish and cheese.
Aroma: caramel, grain, dry fruits, balanced, fine, not extremely intensive. Taste: rather sweet, bitter finish too, but not at super-strong level. Carbonation rather at low level, head is very good.

Robe marron rougeâtre, peu de mousse. Nez boisé, tout comme l’attaque, avec des notes de caramel. Bouche : amertume, fruits noirs secs, abricot. Final sur l’amertume persistante, pointe d’épicé, les fruits secs, et le sucre sur les lèvres.

Cerveza insignia de los fundadores. Dirty Bastard es una cerveza absolutamente hermosa para la vista. De color rubí oscuro y elaborado con diez variedades de maltas importadas, esta cerveza continuamente hace honor a su reputación de cerveza fuerte y audaz. Dirty Bastard es complejo en el final con toques de humo y turba combinados con una riqueza en malta, finalizado con una buena actitud de salto. Esta cerveza "no es para los pequeños muchachos"

Gran Scotch Ale, probada por última vez de barril en la cervecería Europe de Madrid. Color marrón oscuro con un copa espectacular que con cada agitación vuelve a ser frondosa, muy buen comportamiento. En nariz maltas tostadas y bayas, en boca algo de caramelo, malta, cereza y un toque ahumado. Para nada pretende esconder el alcohol, es una cerveza rocosa.

This I will be going back to! Rich and full of taste! You can have it alone or with a good stew or why not some hot tacos!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Niesamowite. Pierwsze zetknięcie z amerykańskim krafcikiem, a naprawdę zwała z nóg. Złożony, słodowy charakter, ale niepodobny do barley wine czy piw belgijskich. Piękna, kremowa piana jak w guinessie. W smaku tak złożone, jak dobra whisky.
Arômes légers de caramel et vanille. Robe ambrée sombre avec peu de mousse. Attaque sur du caramel et du boisé, avec une langueur sur du fumé léger. Pas mal.
Słodowe, ale nie słodkie. Owocowe. Dość gęste, nisko wysycone. Przypomina barley wine ale nie jest tak esencjonalne. Dobrze się pije. Smakuje trochę wytrawnymi, gorzkawymi truskawkami.
Pours SUPER thick and heavy with kind of an oak aroma. Taste a bit bitter at first but has a smooth after taste. A bit to heavy for me.
Dark brown with lasting head. Aroma and flavour have a load of sweet malts. There's a lot of complex fruit sugars present giving a feel of caramelised strawberries.
(dark cuivré, > fruité (noir, red), muté, honey-deep, baie red, melon, fraise, amer & sweet (7 malts), end terre-noix)

Pours rich mahogany with thick, beige head. Aroma is heavy caramel, dried fruit and some earthy tones. Taste is very caramel to start, working to earthy flavor with roast. Finish is very smooth sweet malt. A very enjoyable scotch ale.
Puissante et à ne pas mettre dans toutes les mains, cette brune aux reflets rouges dégage des arômes caramel et un palais fumé, un peu rêche, faisant penser à un whysky.
Belle robe ambrée, nez sur le caramel et la mûre qui apporte de la fraîcheur. En bouche, c'est la mélasse qui domine avec une jolie amertume. Très bonne bière.

Bottle.
Ruby red, brown head. Complex. Raisins, dark fruit, caramel, fig, strong malts, molasses, peat. Smooth. Daedal.
Cloudy red-brown color. Fairly hoppy, but overly so. Good flavor, but nothing to really put it above the rest.

Partagée avec mon cher Appiantiqua dans nos petits verres "Saveur bière".
Belle robe ambrée surmontée d'une mousse beige à grosses bulles peu persistante.
Le nez nous offre des arômes boisés et de whisky.
Le goût nous amène rapidement sur une forte amertume mêlée à une douceur fruitée(fruits jaunes)
le palais est assez long dans le prolongement des saveurs mentionnées.
Un très bon Scotch Ale !16,5/20

Dégustée avec mon petit Kittenbieer dans un verre "Saveur bière". Température de début 10* à 11°
Belle robe ambrée surmontée d'une mousse beige à grosses bulles assez persistante.
Le bouquet aromatique est léger mais plaisant: alcool, whisky, notes boisées.
Le goût nous révèle des saveurs d'abricot, houblons, malt, mandarine et une belle amertume.
La finale de bonne longueur est dominée par les fruits jaunes.
Une très agréable scotch ale.
16,5/20

I had my first Dirty Bastard last night. Appearance was good a red appearance a good taste, almost a little bitterness but not overwhelmingly so. Good after taste and I have to rate this one with high marks, I'll enjoy the 6 pack and will venture in to more of Founders offerings for sure. roasty, herbs, earthy, smoke,

Pours a deep, dark amber coloration with a medium, creamy head. Smells of caramel, bready malts, dark bread and a hint of dark fruit and booze. Taste follows the nose, with a strong malt presence dominated by caramel, bready malt and notes of toffee, dark bread, dark fruit: fig, raisin, with a hint of smoke and chocolate. Some earthy, bittering hop notes in there as well. Finishes with a medium, but kinda harsh, boozy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel with low carbonation. All in all, this is nicely balanced, albeit maybe just a hint too sweet and boozy.

Muddy brown with beige head. Cookie dough, gingerbread sweet aroma. Sweet, grainy mouthfeel, gingerbread and some light medicinal bitterness. Smooth long lasting flavor. I'm coming to realize that this Scotch ale style is fucking bomb and something I can always get down with. Good on Founders to brew more than just the usual suspect styles. Thanks Lagzibacsi!!!

Opalescent brown colour, minimal yellowish-beigeish head; aroma of gingerbread, licorice, caramel, some leather and alcoholic notes; taste of burnt honeycomb, some licorice and alcoholic notes; great one! many thank, kapusil!
0.355l bottle. Slightly hazy dark orange/body with a thin orangish head. Aroma and taste of gingerbread, raisins, caramel, licorice, toast, orange zest and apples. Very nice.
35 flesjes. Helder donker amber kleur, fijne romige creme schuimkraag. De geur van karamel en donker fruit. Smaak is zoet, karamel, rozijnen en donker fruit. Medium Lichaam, Veel koolzuur.
Miły aromat, mało złożony, karmel, trochę wanilii, troszkę alko. W smaku ciut gorzej, karmel, sporo chlebowości, za wysoka goryczka i trochę alkoholu. Spoko
Flaske. Mørk tynd hvid/brun skum som hurtigt forsvinder. Mørk ristet sødlig duft. Mørk ristet malt, let sødme og en smule bitterhed i eftersmag.

Tap @ Opalo, Madrid. Pours hazy dark orange with a small off white head. Aromas of prunes, caramel and sweet malt. Flavours of caramel, prunes, chocolate, wood and peat. Oily texture. Alcohol well hidden.
Backlog. Sample. Caramel, toast, nuts, resin, molasses, some smoke. Medium sweet, moderate bitter.

Hælder mørkebrun og hazy, uden hoved 
Aroma er ovre i toffee, dog med noter af røg.
Smagen er sødlig, med en røget eftersmag
full body, en anelse sticky, soft carbonation, long røget, hoppy ish finish,

En skotsk ale, hvor 10 malte, og hops er brugt. Røgen går igen, uden at være dominant.

Waited till the bottle warmed then poured. Little head, probably due to my preferred light pour, dark in color, enough for no light to pierce. Smells like malty heaven, reminds me of Dead Guy Ale, but +. Good quick hop taste upon tounge then a malty caramel avalance. Mouthfeel is thick, which is nice. I can imagine Vikings drinking beer like this after a conquest lol. Good shit. Very balanced

Deep ruby-red with a creamy, off-white head. Aroma: Scotch whiskey, caramel, hops, campfire smoke, hints of sweet spices. Sweet but well balanced with a bit of hop bitternes, hints of toastyness and smoke. Smooth mouthfeel. This might be the perfedt scotch ale!

Can from Hops and Crafts Exeter. Pours deep ruby with a light beige head. Aroma of oak,caramel,pine,baked bread,citrus ,fig,plum,prune & a little liquorice. Taste is rich & full,pine,caramel,fig,plum,prune,baked bread,liquorice,polished leather,orange zest & oak . Medium bodied,silky smooth mouthfeel. The finish is nicely dry,bittersweet with a growing bitterness & more fig ,plum,prune,bread,biscuit,orange,liquorice,oak & leather . A good scotch ale !

ABV - 8.5 IBU - 50

.Appearance: Dark ruby, head is off white. Looks fantastic. 

.Aroma: You can smell it as soon as it is was poured into the glass. Scotch booziness, roasted malt, caramel, cherry, dark fruit, vanilla. Wow. 

.Taste: Upfront - roasted malt, well rounded sweet fruitiness. Notes of cherry, vanilla, fig, raisin, caramel coming through. Somewhat alcoholic - scotch barrel booziness.  A very noticeable bitterness towards the end of the sip - balancing out the sweetness. Warming. 

.Mouthfeel: Sticky, creamy, rich, medium body, spot on carbonation - giving off a slight "zing." Very easy drinking. 

.Overall: A. 

.Bottom Line: To start - Beautiful in the glass. Aroma and flavor are just outstanding. Be prepared for a big, powerful, delicious malt bill. Top notch scotch ale.
Pours a very dark ruby color.  Scotch and oak taste with sight brown sugar and raisin notes. Not too boozy or overpowering for a strong scotch ale. Great standard Scotch ale.

March 21st, 2015 - Sassily named like San Diego's foundational Stone beers, Founder's Dirty Bastard is a chewy, salty thing. With a black dark body and a deep, malty nose, it offers little hints at first about the flavor profile. But that flavor is lovely and dark, rich with veins of licorice and soy sauce. More impressive than these, though, is the balance between the body and flavor, which are brilliantly engineered to match.
Drank with Tijs @ Piet Huisman 05-01-2018. Sweet, rich, very good. Nice hints of smoke and herbyness.
355ml bottle from RusBeerShop in Moscow. Pours hazy brown with a small beige head. Aroma is malt, smoke, dried fruits, notes of alcohol. Taste is medium sweet, malt, caramel, oak, medium bitterness.
Rozpuszczona landryna, obrzydliwstwo. Mdłości ogarniaja. Nic szlachetnego w tym nie ma, wstrętny ulepek.

Color marrón oscuro, rojizo si le da la luz, turbio, con capa de espuma de un blanco amarronado de dos dedos de grosor y buena retención. Carbonatación media. Textura oleosa. Aroma a caramelo, melaza, lúpulo herbal y alcohol. En boca hay caramelo, melaza, toques herbales, dark fruits y alcohol. No es abiertamente dulce. Amargor final moderado pero presente. Postgusto alcohólico y a caramelo. No entiendo qué hace en un top 50 de Scotch Ales. A partir del primer trago no tiene nada que decir.

Pours dark brown with a creamy head which regenerates easily with a good swirl.
Aroma of malts, peat, lots of alcohol and something almost disgusting like... Vomit!?
Not too sweet, hoppy long lasting finish, but cloying.
Very nice to the palate, full body, creamy and thick.
I really struggled to finish this though.

Can
Aroma-toffee, caramel
Appearance-copper, clear, beige foam
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

29-12-2017; bottle; at home (bought at Saveur Bière, as part of their December 2017 discovery box).
The beer looks very nice. The colour of the beer is a very nice coppery brown, with a nice ruby red glow. The beer is quite clear. On top of the beer there is a nice layer of light brown soft foam. Foam retention is average. A nice thick creamy drape and some lacing are left on the glass. Very nice. 
The smell of the beer is also very nice. It is not extremely strong though. There are some nice malt aromas, with some touches of caramel and toffee. I also smell a nice touch of fruity hops, also a bit earthy. They are a nice match for the malts. There is a tiny smoked touch. This gives a nice savoury edge to the smell. Quite nice, and also special. I don't know many beers like this. 
The taste of the beer is very nice. It is a lovely sweet beer. I taste sweet malts, a touch of liquorice, smoke, peat, toffee and caramel, but also loads of red fruits and some tropical fruit. The hops give a nice earthy and slightly zesty bitterness. Yeast gives a nice fruity and slightly creamy note. Typical top fermented yeast flavour, which is nice. The beer is perfectly balanced. Nice.
The palate of the beer is nice. Medium-full body, smooth and slightly creamy texture, not to heavy, and medium-high carbonation. The finish of the beer is nice. It has a nice alcohol warmth, alcohol flavour, fruits and some lovely hoppy bitters. All in all, a lovely beer. They can be proud to have this as their flagship.

Lekki zawód. Liczylem, że będzie fajny scotch ale, a jest taki sobie. 

W aromacie czuć głównie rodzynki i, niestety, alkohol. Słabo to rokowało. Piwo jest ciemnobursztynowe, z jasną pianą, prezentuje się całkiem ładnie. 

W smaku jest trochę przegazowane, ma konsystencję prawie, że wody, jest słodko-gorzkie. Można wypić, ale nie jest to ambrozja. Za mocno czuć jednak alkohol, goryczka dość średnia, trochę oblepiająca. Piwo powinno poleżeć, bo za bardzo alkohol w nim dochodzi do głosu.

W aromacie suszone owoce, nuty biszkoptowe, przypalony chleb, czuć lekko alkohol. W smaki wytrawny, delikatna słodycz w tle. Na finiszu mocna gorycz. Treściw, intensywne, alkohol średnio ukryty, średnio pijalne, zbyt gorzkie dla mnie. Dobre piwo, ale zdecydowanie #teamgoryczka
inte så knäckig som jag hade förväntat mig. bra fyllighet och ordentligt med smak.
Schöner Malzcharakter im Aroma. Im Trunk herrlich cremig, Schokode, Nuss, Karamell, super komponiert. Im Abgang dann röstig, Holzfass, hohe Drinkability, extraklasse.

355 ml. bottle @ Home.
Aroma: quite intense aromas of caramel, toasted malts, brown sugar, molasses, dark dried fruits (prunes, raisins), sweet alcohol, overripe fruit. Hints of honey, porto wine, rum. Hints of malts and toasted malts in the background when the beer warmed up.
Appearance: deep ruby to deep brown/mahogany color with reddish-ruby highlights. Beige and very creamy foam. Medium to high head thickness. Medium to high retention. Medium Brussels' lacing. It's too dark to tell for sure, but it seems it has low to medium hazyness.
Taste: medium to high sweetness, low bitterness, no sourness. Flavors of caramel, toasted malts, brown sugar, molasses, overripe fruit, dark dried fruits (mainly prunes and raisins), sweet alcohol. Hints of rum and porto wine, dates. Balance is toward the sweet side.
Palate: medium body, oily-silky texture, low carbonation, very long sweet finish with medium sweetness and flavors of sweet alcohol, caramel, toffee, toasted malts, brown sugar, molasses, dark dried fruits (raisins, prunes, dates). Alcohol is noticeable due to its sweetness and some throat warming. There is no astringency from the dark malts in this beer.
Palate: appearance is very good. Aromas and flavors are very good and sweet but not cloying, with caramel, toffee, toasted malts, brown sugar, molasses, dark dried fruits (prunes and raisins) and sweet alcohol. Not my favourite style, but it's a very good and enjoyable beer. Not much hop aromas nor flavors. Very complex.

Puszka 355ml. Kolor piękny ciemnobursztynowy z przebłyskami, klarowne, piana kremowa pięknie osiada na szkle. Aromat generalnie suszone owoce, śliwki, rodzynki. W smaku także suszone owoce, słodkie co w połączeniu z goryczką daje wyśmienity efekt. Alkohol ukryty genialnie, bardzo dobre piwo, mocno pijalne.

Draught. Great looking beer dark ruby with off white head. Light Aroma, malt and smoke. Flavour had a little alcohol burn covered quickly with chocolate and malt. Lekker finish with a hop spike and smoke

Aromat: intensywność średnia w kierunku dużej, nuty zbożowej, subtelnie suszone i kandyzowane owoce, rodzynki, figi, karmel.
Wygląd: wygląda cudnie, piękna czysta czerwona miedź i bardzo wysoka, idealnie równa i regularna warstwa, kremowej, drobnopęcherzykowej piany, która długo się utrzymuje.
Smak: typowy dla stylu, nie jest ani za słodkie, ani za wytrawne. Delikatny karmel, dużo suszonych owoców, rodzynki, daktyle, figi, dużo ciemnych i świeżych owoców, zbozowe posmaki bazy słodowej, wszystko kontrowane całkiem niezłą, ziołową i leciutko paloną goryczką. Bardzo pijalne, pije się lekko i przyjemnie. Dobrze zbalansowane. Złożone.
Odczucie: alkohol ukryty perfekcyjnie, ciała dużo, wysycenie niskie, pełne, finisz gorzkawy.
Całość: bardzo smaczne i stylowe piwo, świetny balans i kompozycja, wysoka pijalność mimo mocy i blg, Goryczka duża, ale tu akurat gra jak trzeba, naprawdę zdradziecko lekkie. Bardzo dobre. 7/5/7/4/15

Tomada en Cervecer�a GastroTres Gijon.

De grifo.
Bien. Correcta. Color rojo. Espuma blanca.
Maltosa y alcohomica.

Sporo aromatów słodowych, biszkoptowych, lekko opiekanych. W smaku lekkie jak na ekstrakt, ale nie wodniste, wyraźne nuty słodowe, biszkoptowe, opiekane, lekka słodycz, nuty ciemnych owoców, goryczka wyraźna, lekko przypalana. Alkohol zupełnie niewyczuwalny.

Love this beer. It sits right on the edge of a complex taste but a with a smoothness where I could drink this all day. You can taste the sweetness of the malt, the kick of the hops and even a bit of a smokey flavor infused in it. I even like the amount of alcohol in it, enough to feel relaxed but without overwhelming the flavors.

Can 355ml (gusher). Reddish-brown, thick fluffy head with plenty of lacing and a light beige tint. Aroma of milk chocolate, raisins, port wine. Taste is heavy on raisin, dates and almost some dry sherry, ending with a dry smoky and surprisingly hoppy bitterness. Enjoyable and complex!
A bench mark Beer to match for all Scotch Ales. This unique beer is undeniably best in its category and an experience to drink. Great aroma and even better taste!!

Zapach średnio intensywny, słód, karmel, cukier, orzechy, suszone owoce. Kolor miedziany, klarowne. Piana beżowa, niska, drobna, średnio trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku słodkie, średnia pełnia, słód, karmel, cukier, suszone owoce, zioła, chleb, dym, alkohol. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie średnie.

Aroma is honey and caramel. Taste is sweet, with cocoa, and grass. Aftertaste is bittersweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of the better beers I have ever consumed! Beautiful color and great taste. Highly recommend 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piwo ma ciemno miedzianą barwę, nalewa się z bujną, beżową i mocno zdobiącą szkło pianą. 
Aromat jest mało intensywny. Melasa, palony karmel, nuta orzechów, a gdzieś w tle niuanse popiołowe, ogniskowe. Drugi plan to ziołowo-tytoniowa nuta chmielu.
W smaku pełne i raczej słodkie. to co w aromacie, z tymże chmielowa strona jest wyraźniejsza, budująca mocną kontrę dla słodowości. Goryczka jest wysoka, lekko cierpka, ziołowa i ziemista w posmaku.
Backlog rating. Hazy red brown, low brown head. Orangepeel, piney hops and roast nose. Orangepeel, herbs, pine on the palate as well. Medium body, sparkly mouthfeel.

bottle @ home
clear dark brown, brown head
butterscotch, wild honey, manuka honey, cream, light alcohol notes, walnuts, roasted nuts, milk chocolate, heater, light sweet licorice
cream, licorice, coconut, nuts, makadamija,

From bottle into pint glass. Aroma is a nice, full roasted malt with burnt, molasses, and espresso notes. Tastes sweet and full with a slightly bitter hop kick at the end. Medium-full body with a creamy/oily texture. Delicious!

UT271117. 12fl oz bottle at home from Burg Bieren, Ermelo. Nose is Roasted malt, dried fruits. Caramel, brownie, old wood. Medium bittersweet. Long roasty hoppy medium to heavy bitter. Full body oily medium carb. 857516
One of my favorite beers. This is a great strong beer with a full body, excellence. Caramel, bread,  resin, smoke, peat. Malt forward some hops!
Toffee, raisins, "julmust". Quite sweet but with enough background bitterness to make it pleasant. A nice scotch ale

Burk från SB. Mörk kastanjefärgad med tjusigt, krämigt smutsvitt lock. Maltigt och rostat med toner av knäck, karamell, kola, torkad frukt, mörkt socker, melass. Lite beska från humlen väger upp. Välbalanserat och smarrigt!

Pours a foggy brown with an amber tint with 1 finger of head with good lacing. Smell is complex caramel, very malty in a good way, toffie, and roast. Taste is rich with a smooth finish malty, smokey, and slightly hoppy. I normally drink Belhaven when I want a scotch ale, not anymore.
Dark fruits, fruits overall, biscuits, maybe some chocolate notes and long terrible bitterness

Barwa brązowa, piana spora.
Aromat lekki biszkopt, ciasto z bakaliami, wiśnie.
W smaku biszkopty, chleb, karmel, toffi. 
Ciała trochę mało, alko ukryte.
Fajne pifko.
a great drink; malty complex flavor; full body, creamy, soft carbonation, medium sweetness, long finish

Where Purchased: 347ml bottle from Meijer in Michigan
Consumed: from a pilsner glass  
Aroma: Smells malty and sweet with hoppy note.Seems complex.
Appearance : unfiltered dark gold brown with lots of head that disappears within the first few sips. No lacing, but lots of lively carbonation.
Taste: very sweet and malty with an underlying hop note. Would never guess the IBU was 50 or the ABV was 8.8. Impressive. Lots of complex tastes yet easy to drink. 
Palate : full body. Slight bitter with sweet aftertaste. Great carbonation.
Overall: this was a complex beer. Lots of malts. Easy drinking, and would never know it was as boozy as it was. I was glad to try and will buy again. MB. The Beer "Bear"on.
,3 litre Bottle from Total Wine Bocca Park. Brown with medium offwhite head. Roasted malt aroma and taste.

It pours dark brown and it is fairly clear. It has a tan head with low head retention. A full malt aroma, complex and inviting. It has some caramel and moderate smoky elements. The are also low aromas of alcohol as well. There are flavors of caramel and nuts. There is a low roasted character to it with low smoke. There is moderate bitterness and a very low dried fruit (Plums) element. It has a moderately full body with some alcohol warmth. Overall, a complex malty beer that highlights malts with a bit of light smoke. A great drinking Wee Heavy.

This is one of Founders best and amongst all other Scotch Ales I feel it superior to most others. I have tried over fifteen scotch ales and this is the one I most frequently purchase when I want an excellent Scotch Ale that wont break the bank.

Utan motstånd uppstår heller ingen framåtrörelse. Utan brittisk ale hade heller inte resten av världens ölkultur varit på samma ställe som den är i dag. Dirty bastard är något att ta spjärn emot när ölkartor ska revideras och nya smakupplevelser ska kalibreras. Hela skapelsen är otroligt fint avrundad i alla hörn. Kraftig rostad malt bärs upp av alkoholstyrka utan att bli spritig och eftersmaken är långt ihållande smakfull och bränd.

Bottle. Misty brown with ruby highlights. Moderate ivory-coloured well-lacing head. Aroma: malt symphony. Caramel, toffee, toast. Lots of nicely sourish fruit jam, dried fruit, some oak. Medium body. Moderately dry taste. Rich malts, again. Nuts, oak, fruits. Light bitterness. So good

Can @ home. Pours a Ruby to brown liquid with a creamy head. Sweet aroma with toffee, caramel, chocolate, licorice, mild smoke, red fruits. Smooth palate with average carbonation. Medium to full body. Taste of deep caramel, toffee, dark bread, licorice, smoke, chocolate, red fruits, some herbs. Lasting taste with an earthy and smoky finish. Lingering licorice. Balanced low to medium bitterness.

From the bottle. Dark brown with a tan, creamy head. Aroma is earthy with chocolate and Backhaus. Taste is sweet up front, full of chocolate, licorice, smoke and caramel. Finishes warm with a whisp of bitterness. Body is full, rich, creamy. Overall a complex, we’ll balanced brew that betrays absolutely no sign of it’s ABV. I‘m at a loss for words. Excellent!

35,5cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Troebel roodbruin met een dunne gebroken witte schuimkraag. G: Veel gedroogd fruit, karamel en wat chocolade. S: Zoet. Chocolade, gedroofd fruit, wat vanille, toffee en kandijsuiker. Lichte nabitterheid. M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.

Founders has so many varieties, each excellent for its style. My rating probably says more about my lack of enthusiasm for Scotch Ale, and less about Founders quality. Rate Beer descriptor notes. Bogata karamelno sladko sladna sladica s škotskim naglasom. Crème brûlée brez crème aroma, rahlo cvetlična. Temno bakrena barva. Povsem bistro. Krasna beige pena drobnih mehurčkov. Srednje obstojna. Okus sledi aromi zažgane karamele, ki daje občutek dimljenosti. Grenčina je izrazita in traja v pookusu. Polnega telesa in opazne alkoholnosti kot lepe protiuteži karamelni sladnosti.

Botella de 99Cervezas.

Vierte en un realmente bonito color miel rojizo, que en la copa resulta bastante opaco. Abundante formación de espuma de café de gran densidad, buena persistencia y notable adherencia.

De gran intensidad en nariz, destacan las notas dulces y acarameladas, siempre de un modo contenido y muy equilibrado (en absoluto empalagoso). Prevalecen entre estas las notas de naranja confitada, acompañadas de claras notas terrosas y de turba. También un punto de café con leche y de toffee. Las notas lupuladas están siempre de fondo equilibrando muy bien el dulce. Gran complejidad.

Resulta sorprendente en boca, dando intensas notas de dulce de regaliz y toffee. De entre los sabores básicos destacan el dulce y el amargo, imponiéndose este último conforme la cerveza evoluciona en boca. Es un amargo muy expresivo pero elegante y nada agresivo. La evolución en boca trae también notas intensas de turba. Muy bien equilibrada y muy interesante evolución.

De gran cuerpo, textura aterciopelada y algo rasposa, y carácter más bien cálido. Gran persistencia (sin llegar nunca a saturar) y final amargo con un toque dulce. Su graduación alcohólica (8,5% ABV) no se nota en absoluto (ni en nariz ni en boca), lo que demuestra de nuevo el tremendo equilibrio de esta cerveza.

Complejidad, equilibrio y carácter a raudales, mostrados a través de una estupenda evolución en boca. Si quieres conocer y disfrutar un estilo que es casi de culto, esta Scotch Ale es tu cerveza. Debes probarla.
@ Basunen 17-9-9: En lite diskret scotch ale med toner av malt och kola, en söt eftersmak. tja
Degustada en Olut Nomada Brewing Scotch Ale,buen cuerpo ,cerveza acaramelada con ligero amargor  final con aromas a regaliz.
