Big full bodied style but very well executed and never strays from an appropriate stylistic line. I’ve only had the core range from Founders but I get the sense the brewery knows how to make a modern beer AND respect tradition at the same time. Some bourbon and coke, as expected, and rich, but never stupid which is a good effort given the 8.5%. Not sure many Scotch Ales get over this number? Some fizz to finish which takes the edge off the sweetness.

3 finger beige head.
Very dark brown coloured beer.


Aroma is alcohol drenched raisins, caramel, dates, slight pine and smoked charcuterie. Quite vinous too.


Taste is dates, soil, caramel, big whisky smokeyness, raisins and a slight metallic note at the back, that doesn't stop it from being good but rather hinders it from being better.


Mouthfeel is rich and a bit dry. Medium bitterness and lightly carbonated. Could definitely use more of a punch though, it feels too gentle, even though that adds to the pleasant smoothness this beer has.


Overall: Like I have previously mentioned, Founders can do no wrong. Or hasn't yet, in any case. This is not the most exciting beer I have had but it's simply a very pleasing beer to sip. You get a hint of the alcoholic smokeyness but any actual alcohol taste is barely there, which makes this very drinkable. I'm glad this is one of the regulars at the Swedish monopoly now, especially since winter is coming.
Amazing beer. Great rich and dark malty flavor. Medium to heavy body with a dark chocolate finish. Low carbonation. One of my favorite beers.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso si spiaggia su orzo tostato. L’intensità olfattiva è elevata e la persistenza olfattiva è apprezzabile. Il cappello di schiuma persistente ha una buona tenuta e appena aperta la bottiglia la schiuma di colore marrone chiaro esce da sola. La grandezza delle poche bollicine è medio-fine. La carbonazione è nella norma. L’aspetto del liquido è velato. Il colore è marrone chiaro. La carbonazione è persistente. Il corpo è strutturato non pesante. La struttura è cremosa. Il dolce è medio in buon equilibrio con l’amaro medio. L’intensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è piacevole. Il finale è lungo, pulito e complesso. Il retrogusto è intenso. L’aroma in bocca riporta sentori di caramello, miele, nocciola, pane tostato e alcol presente.

Pours a thick ruby brown red with a rich malty bready aroma. The taste is full roasty malts with a smoky aftertaste and that classic syrupy scotch ale mouthfeel. Definitely not a session beer or one I would want on the reg, this one lives up to its name; it is nasty and coarse (in good ways) and effective. Overall, another winner from Founders, even if the style isn’t a favorite of mine. Good for mixing up the tahini in more ways than one before a big Seder party!

355ml bottle @ hotel room morning beer. Bottled 2016.12.29

Pours a rich brown colour with a decent creamy tan head. Nose is caramel malts. Flavour is a mix of caramel and light scotch(with no heat), the IBUs become quite apparent with a lasting bitterness. It is rich and very smooth, just the bitterness puts me off... but that’s me.

King of American Scotch ales--all hail the Bastard. Pours a gloriously rich red with a massive layer of foam and ample lacing. Smells like a sticky bun eaten on a Scottish moor. Starts with a burst of dark caramel and toffee, yet never grows overly sweet, instead rolling around in the peat with a whisky-tinged smoky backbone. Grows surprisingly hoppy for the style, adding a needed balance to the heavy malts, sliding into a lovely bittersweet fade. God, what a great brew.
On tap at Elizabeth Station. Pours a hazy copper with a tan heae. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel. Taste is pretty the same with. Good.

Chuck’s 85th, Seattle. Thin small tan head, cloudy malty copper-amber. Malty caramel nose. Heavy clean scotch ale, bitter dark amber. Quite bitter profile, quite nice. Dark toffee caramel, slight metallic, deep bitter roast. Cool body, but some alcohol richness and bite on finish. Nice.

Pours a dark brown, almost black color with a decent sized, beige head.

Smells of molasses, caramel malts, burned toffee and earth - rustic and inviting.

Has a very low carbonation, silk on the tongue, very sweet till mid palate until the finish, in which a pungent dryness mingles together with the initial maltiness.

Toffee malts with a rustic earth wrapping creates the taste foundation in this. Gets a very pleasant roasty touch during mid palate, enriching the malts, with a slowly evolving herbal note. After the swallow hops get way more noteable, producing an almost tongue numbing dryness of dried grass, replacing the sweetness by even more earthen toast in the finish.

Pretty darn wild on the tongue, sweet, roasty, then dry- convincing in every of its aspects with a great balance.

Bottle @ Morton’s Market. Rich, creamy, sweet maltiness, toffee, nuts, hint of bourbon like aroma & taste. Palate is so smooth and complex - both with rich flavor and a delightful aftertaste of smokey peat and holiday spices. This is now truly my favorite style...and, along with Old Chub, this is my favorite Scotch Ale. A perfect brew. Food-pairing Note: Try it with Large Black Cerignola Olives. Absolutely delicious!

Can from Sake no Taniguchi. Pours a deep dark ruby with lovely light tan foam. Rich sweet malt aroma, toffee, bourbon-like booze note, some peat smoke. Nice malt flavour, full and rich toffee and caramel, not too sweet, hits the back of the throat quickly with rising warmth, but leaves some sweet residue and smoke on the tongue. Really lovely and smooth to drink, full yet buoyed by hopping. I love this style and these flavours really ooze out and linger over the course of a whole can. Great stuff.

Sweet scents of malt and caramel. Pours a rich clear mahogany with tight tan head. Excellent lacing. Tastes of caramel malt and leather with a lingering sour hops finish. Viscous mouthfeel with mild carbonation. A substantial ale that I really like.
Post club cata Olut. Suave , redonda. En boca algo dulce y maltosa, nada alcoholica pese a sus 8,5°.Aroma a regaliz.

Niezłe scotch ale. Palony karmel, toffi, figi, śliwki suszone, lekka czekolada, nawet ser pleśniowy w tle ;) Lekka wędzonka, alko nie czuć co najwyżej lekko rozgrzewa. Generalnie słodkie piwo, ale nie tak bardzo ulepkowate, z doskonałą lekką wedzoną kontrą. To jest właśnie scotch ale. Sweet, burnt devil.

Bottle. Nice amber colour, clear with white head. Aroma of candi sugar, figs, berries and toasted malt. In taste sweet, fruity with caramel and dried fruits. Medium body, quite dry and lightly bitter finish. Really nice.

Une bière brune, avec une bonne carbonatation et une bonne opacité au niveau de la couleur. Au nez, beaucoup d’arômes avec notamment du sucre d’orge, un peu de torréfaction, et des épices. En bouche, on retrouve beaucoup de saveurs de caramel, avec une petite impression d’amertume en fin de bouche. De bonnes impressions d’épices proviennent également du liquide. Le corps est rond, riche, sans être trop lourd non plus, donnant un bel équilibre. Belle bière.

Bottle. Sweet, lots of residual sugars, red fruit jelly, caramel, dried fruit, lots of walnuts. Thickish though not oily, dry, nutty, astringent finish, fruity but also very malty flavour. I liked everything about it, save for its lingering astringency.

Bottle (Edeka Gronemann, Castrop-R.): Deep ruby-amber coloured, almost clear, small off-white foamy layer; rich sweet bitter aroma of caramel, port-wine and dried fruits, herbal hops and traces of soy-sauce in the background; solid bitter-sweet flavour, medium to full bodied; lingering drier and hoppier finish with flavours of - again - caramel and dried fruits. Classy and well balanced stuff, the right winter-warmer...
Dark red color with medium head. Aroma of hops and some fruit. Flavor of hops, alcohol, dark chocolate and some smoke.Medium bitterness, light sweetness, a little spicy. Long bitter finish.
Trübes dunkelrot mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, sehr süß, etwas Karamell, nussig, leicht fruchtig, etwas Pflaume, leicht alkoholisch.
12oz bottle pours amber with tan head decent lacing, dark roasted malt scent, taste of molasses, prunes a little of dates, solid brew
è la prima scotch ale che bevo! mi ha conquistato. Non vedo l’ora di riprenderla

Pours a hazy mahogany color with medium beige head. Aroma has notes of caramel, toffee, vanilla, dates, cherries and prunes. Taste follows the nose, brown sugar, caramel/toffee, cherries, prunes, dark riped fruits, vanilla beans, earth and molasses.

12 fluid oz bottle. Pours a brown tinged burgundy with a light haze and a lovely tan cap. On the nose burnt sugar, dates, toffee, a faint earthy note, and very light smoke. Taste wise, light sweetness well hidden under dark roasty malt, raisin, a decent amount of mineral heavy bitterness, faint molasses, and some woody notes that heads into brown sugar, dry dark malt notes, light ash, faint butterscotch, molasses and bitter dark coffee in the finish. It’s not spectacular but it’s so damn solid, and the 8.5% alcohol is dangerously non-apparent. I would buy it again in a second. It’s kind of the perfect beer for winter.

23.11.2016 - Aroma of old light smoked leather and alcohol. There are some peaty and smoky notes in this full bodied thick strong ale. Oily (cara) malty palate.
Alcoholic and bitter finish.

0.355 l bottle from ’CraftBeer-Dealer.com’, apparently best before November 2016 (import label). Very dark red with a thin, frothy, almost stable, beige head. Sweetish-malty, slightly fruity aroma of caramel, molasses, prunes, raisins and candied cherries. Very sweet, malty and slightly fruity taste of molasses, toffee, raisins, prunes, some vanilla, candied cherries and hints of chocolate, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter, slightly warming-alcoholic finish. Medium to full body, slightly oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very nice sipper!

Pours dark brown, beige and persistent foam on top. Aroma is boozy, yet sweet and caramel-acidic. Ripe prunes in a slightly bitter jam. Taste is also showcasing this beers abundant hopping, bitterness from alcohol and from the hops are blending nicely, thick body, solid flavour profile. For me feels like a very good specimen of its style, bitterness is taking out a lot of excessive sweetness, so I think I like this one more than most Scotch Ales out there.

Une robe acajou aux étincelants reflets rubis est surmontée d’une mousse brunâtre bien compacte à la durée de vie moyenne. Du caramel écossais légèrement brûlé, des céréales délicatement fumées et de la mélasse constituent le bouquet "sucré" de cette célèbre Dirty Bastard. En bouche, c’est la continuité des arômes détectés avec une touche sucrée un peu plus prononcée. Une texture svelte en bouche véhicule bien les saveurs qui se terminent dans une amertume plutôt prononcée pour le style.

Tap @ Keg & Brew. Murky brown with minimal dirty cream head. Aromas of molasses, vegetation, caramel malts, cherry, oak elements and peaty smoke. Some earthy hop bitterness, which perfectly balances the sweetness. Great beer.
Aus der Flasche im Alten Mädchen getrunken. Trübes Schwarzbraun mit wenig Schsum im Glas. Markante Malz- und Holzaromen.

Poured into a pint ale glass at 45-50 degrees, deep ruby with a 1/2 inch head that falls. Aroma is caramel, slight over ripe pear to plum with a hint of alcohol. Taste strong ripe plum dark fruit with slight bitterness. Finish caramel with hay, smoke, earthy - dry hop tones. One of Founders strengths, Dirty Bastard is a complex ale that provides extreme value for the dollar. One to be enjoyed and revisited when the others fail.

Aroma; caramel, toffee, nut, leaves, mild fruit peel. Look; apricot-beige head, dark hazy caramel brown body. Taste; caramel, roasted malts, hops, nut, yeast - leading to a caramellish yeast-malted finish. Feel; solid body. Overall; tasty sipper. [35.5cl.btl 8.5% BB.28.11.2016 B@Systembolaget]

Bonito color caoba, muy oscura con buena espuma cremosa ocre. Buen aroma, de predominio dulce y licórico. En boca presenta cuerpo moderado y un excelente tono ricamente malteado, acaramelada, de cierta complejidad: fruto seco, chocolate, notas de madera, licor... que deja rico postgusto
Bottle from Liquor Barn. Pours dark brown with tan foam. Spicy aroma and taste of molasses and raisins. Finish is bittersweet caramel malt. Beautifully made complex ale.

Pours ruby brown with caramel head which colapses to a lacing. Looks great. Aroma of burnt caramel and iron. At first I was not a massive fan of the aroma, found it a bit metallic, but it grew on me right up until the end. The taste if sweet burnt caramel, smoke, molasses, spice. Reminded me of a slightly spicier Old Tom by Robinsons Brewery which is also 8.5% abv.
Bottle @home. Pours brown, tan head. Nose is molasses, toffee, chocolate, caramel. Taste is chocolate, slight smoke, slight fruit.

L:
-pours a dark brown with ruby tinges and a medium,foamy,beige head
S:
-cooked potatoes,herbal,plums,figs,raisins,caramel,chocolate,licorice,syrup
T:
-herbal,plums,raisins,syrup,caramel,spicy,grassy,pine
-medium to high,lingering bitterniss for the style
F:
-low to medium carbonation
-light to medium body
-alcohol noticeable
O:
This is pretty great.sweet ale with a strong English Hop Presence.

Bottle from somewhere. Color is dark copper to brown. Head is medium and beige to brown. Aroma is spicy, pepper, malt, caramel, fruity, malt, nutty. Medium carbonation and body. Sweetness is medium, bitterness is light to medium. Flavour is chocolate, caramel, spices. This is not my kind of style of beer, but it’s great!
Bottle from SB. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma is caramel, malt, bread spices, syrup, honey. Sweet spicy tastes, hints of smokiness, dry finish. Medium bodied.

As braw a Scotch ale as ever crossed this gullet. If the score seems low, it reflects tepid enthusiasm for the style, rather than the beer. Clear ruby with a prodigious, lacing head. Almost Ribena-purple in the twilight. The nose is all molten toffee and fermenting dark malts. Something about it screamed Hallowe’en - must be molasses, conjuring memories of treacle-dipped scones dangling from the ceiling when I was a nipper. Slick body, low carbonation. Strong vanilla notes, caramel, clove, raisins and some woody/herbal hop notes for character. Sweet but saved by the hops. Can imagine drinking a lot of this through the long Michigan winter nights. (355ml bottle from Leura Cellars)

Dark amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, dark fruit, caramel, & some vanilla; Flavor of smoky sweet malt, caramel, molasses, dark fruit, vanilla, and spice; Nicely balanced; Pretty good overall.

On draft at Sharp Edge Brasserie. Poured dark brown with thin khaki head. Thick lace. Complex flavor with sweet malt, toffee, raisins, figs, cloves. Touch thinner body than I was expecting. Boozy finish.
Bottle at home. Clear dark amber/ruby. Aroma heavy malty (caramel, raisins, chocolate, toffee). Flavor heavy sweet, caramel, dark fruits, chocolate. Full body, smooth carbonated.

Pretty nice aroma... hops and a lot of roasted malts. It has a pretty good appearence: solid and uniform dark brown color, with a consistent think head of yellowish foam. Overall, a pretty tasty and bitter ale.
bitter and also sweet with caramel tasty. full body, caramel, brown, clear,

Botella 33 cl en el cheers Oviedo. 12..10..2016. (r2466). Fcpref2la..11..2016. Color marrón oscuro turbio con espuma beige Aromas y sabores maltosos algo tostados con toques caramelos y ligeras especias secas. Cuerpo medio algo denso y espumoso con 8.5 vol que se dejan notar en todo momento. Toda una Scotch ale

Dark ruby appearance with a sustainably light tan head. The aroma is caramel and toffee all the way with a touch of leather inbetween. In the tasting the caramel malt leap forward while complex flavors of smoke, toffee, coffee, chocolate and toast. A real nice beer to cozy up with amidst the fall season setting in.

the aroma of caramel, red wine, raisin, brown chocolate, toffee and robust... the taste is caramel and fruity with notes of sweet wine, dark fruits, milk chocolate, brown sugar, toffee and some spices... bright hopping... sweet, bitter, dry and warming aftertaste...
Хороший напиток, сильный приятный винный аромат, мощный вкус с горечью, карамель во вкусе, согревающее продолжительное послевкусие. Срок годности до 06.02.17. (Bottle 0,355/ 8,5%)

Can from Tanakaya. Pours a deep reddish brown with a finger of foam that dissipates quickly. Lots of toasted caramel, roasted malt and peat on the nose with a touch of vanilla. More roasted malt and peat on the palate with quite a bit of hoppy bitterness. Not my thing, but it accomplishes what it sets out to do. Well-made.

Bottle at home. Chestnut-ruby colour, hazy, beige foamy head. Really malty with caramel, raisins, herbal, clove, cough syrup, porto/red vinous, nuts, quite alcoholic, bitter finish: complex altogether. Aftertaste?s nice. Firm body, oily to sticky mouthfeel, low carbonation.

0.355 bottle.  
 A clear, brown color with a crimson tinge to it and a medium, cream-colored head. Aroma of very rich malts, caramel, wood, and butter. Taste is sweet, nutty, very malty, leathery, and a tad fruity. A full body, a creamy texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is more alcoholic than the rest and introduces some bitter notes but otherwise remains roughly the same. Overall it is a good beer, it struggles to keep its alcohol under control towards the end but that could be expected of a scotch ale.

Una scotch ale hecha y derecha. De color ámbar cobrizo, corona de espuma color marfil de buena retención, con burbujas compactas. En el aroma el dulzor destaca, notas a caramelo, toffee y algo de nueces. En boca nuevamente el caramelo y toffee destaca, el amargor ligero alto no astringente, con un retrogusto ligeramente dulce.

Bottle at home. Pours dark amber with medium beige head. Aroma is sweet and malty with dried fruits. Taste is dry honey melon with malts, raisins and bit of booze. Aftertaste is sweet alcohol. Palate is dry, medium bodied with long finish. Not your average ale, but nice and tasty.
Nice thick mouthfeel. Great malt profile, sweet yet balanced. Very nice and easy to drink.
Red amber with beige head and a rich malty note. Sweetness in nose and taste with rich round notes. Palate leaves a little short but almost oily and with distinctive malty notes.
Bottle. Dark brown copper color. Aroma of sweet caramelised malt and spices. Taste of caramelised malt, bitter coffee, leather, spices and mild smoke. Founders is never bad.

355ml bottle. Dark amber brown colour with a one finger beige head. Aroma: rich malts, dark fruits, caramel. Taste: rich sweet fruity malts, ripe dark fruit, caramel, hint of smoke, some alcohol. Sweet finish with a slight hoppy bitterness in the aftertaste. Medium to full body, sticky mouthfeel.

On tap at La Tape.
Weak aroma, caramel and fruity.
Taste is prune, ripe dark fruit, some alcohol and some fruity acidity.
Medium creamy palate.
Bottle - Pours deep amber-brown, white head. Sweet malty, earthy, caramel, raisins, hops, alcohol.

Tap at Founders. Clear mahogany with beige head. Lots of caramel, light cocoa, brown sugar, toffee and a bit of grassy hops in the finish. Over medium sweet and light bitter. Over medium bodied with soft carbonation and sugary feel.

Bottle - Clear reddish brown colour, medium beige head with good retention. Sweet malty aromas of caramel, dried red fruits, some leather, cigar and a touch of smoke. Taste is also sweet with a lot of caramel, some dried fruits, honey, toasted nuts and smoke. Full body, soft carbonation, velvety texture, sweet finish. Great scotch ale with complex maltiness and decent smokiness.

Bottle at home (bottled 04/20/16). Pours a clear red brown with an off-white head. Aroma of sweet malts, caramel, hint of chocolate, dark fruits, smoke. Taste is over moderate sweet, moderate bitter, sweet malts, caramel, dark fruits, hint of chocolate, smoke and peaty towards the end, hoppy bitter peaty aftertaste. Nice.

Bottle@ home. Pours dark ruby color with light brown head. Aroma has caramel, toffee, ripe fruits and raisins. Taste is malty sweet with long fruity and a bit bitter aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, toffee, raisins, butter and oak.

12 oz pour from can into tulip. Pours deep brown, opaque, weak off-white head. Nose is sweet and malty, a little earthy. Body is medium to full, creamy. Taste is sweet, nutty, malty. Solid, easy to drink.

Medium brown with a dense one-finger off-white head and sticky lace. Rich malty aromas - bread, dark fruits, caramel, brown sugar and tobacco. Big bold malt sweetness with hints of smoke, yeast and alcohol and herbal hops. Medium to full body, chewy sticky mouthfeel, medium carbonation and a rich sweetness in the finish.

Ambar avermelhado/marrom translúcido, espuma marrom claro de boa formação e persistência, linda. Caramelo e maltado intensos e nítidos, vanilla, leve amadeirado. No paladar aparece mais o amargor do lúpulo dividindo espaço com o dulçor caramelado. Corpo e carbonatação de média intensidade, bem dosados. Final tem um pouco de madeira, defumado residual, toffe queimado, licor de cacau. Álcool fica mais nítido com aumento da temperatura, mas bem inserido.
A very smoky, brisk taste with a small bite. Pine, caramel and the slightest taste of hops. A smooth beer, pleasant to drink!

12 oz. can at the house. What a wonderful beer. Smoky and caramel are the aromas of this dark deep rich beer. Thin beige head, this thicker beer is complex with malt, caramel and a sweetness to it. Over all just Outstanding! Makings of a great winter warmer.

From XXXII. In Teku glass. Playing Grim Fandango Remastered. Standard interpretation of the style. Nothing bad in it but there are better, cheaper and more easily accessible interpretations of that style, like the Gordon’s one

Poured a deep coppery-brown with a slight translucence and an orangey-tan dense foam head that retained very well and laced OK. Carbonation moderate and fine. Aroma of sweet rich malty caramels and alcohol. Taste initially with slightly roasted malts, very sweet toffee/caramel malts and sweet dark fruits; low bitterness; alcohol throughout taste profile masks other flavours. Medium body. Smooth, soft, clean, slightly creamy and a bit syrupy but too much alcohol on the finish.

W aromacie słodycz, karmel, tostowość, masa rodzynek, szlachetnego utlenienia w stronę sherry. W smaku podobnie, bardziej tostowe niż karmelowe, słodkie suszone owoce przełamane naprawdę potężną, ale krótką goryczką o lekko ziemistym, przypalonym tostowym charakterze. Wzorowo ukryty alkohol, pije się bardzo łatwo. Świetne!

Bottle. Dark ruby color with light brown head. Aroma has caramel, toffee, ripe fruits and raisins. Taste is malty sweet with long fruity and a bit bitter aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, toffee, raisins, butter and oak.
Hazy brown color with off-white head. Aroma is smokey, like also the flauvour. Medium sweet. Some warming alcohol, but it fits fine for this beer, so it’s not disturbing. Recommendable beer.

Dark fruit aroma with a bit of spice, roasty and sweet. Dark brown / ruby color, with some haziness. Visible carbonation. Tall tan creamy head, receding slowly. Nice lacing down the glass. Thick and smooth feel. Initial taste follows the aroma... lots of malty complexity, a little sweet, with dark fruits. The finish has the bittering hops assert themselves into the aftertaste, which seem a bit overdone or overhopped for a scotch ale.
Kevyempi kuin imperial stout, mutta makua löytyy. Hieman viinainen jälkimaku, ei häiritsevä.
Keg at Common, Manchester. Hazy brown shade. Thin head. Big candy-ish fruity notes, tobacco and sticky maltiness all the way through. Quite an earthiness to it as well. Good example of the style.
Hints of caramel, chocolate and smoke. Creamy head. Medium sweet taste. Relatively light body considering ABV. Soft carbonation. Bitter finish.

Farbe: Dunkles rot-braun, erinnert an Kirschsaft, heller wenig beständiger Schaum.
Geruch: Malz, Holz, leicht säuerlich, etwas Rauch
Geschmack: malzig, säuerlich, leicht holzig und rauchig, zum Abgang dann auch noch hopfen- (und röst-?) bitter. Recht alkoholisch, aber nicht störend.
Gut!

In der Nase viel Holz, Whisky und Vanille. Anschließend im Mund schlank. Erinnerungen an Wein, Fass und Whisky werden geweckt. Erst leicht süß, dann schnell radikal whiskeyscharf. Der Nachhall alkoholisch wärmend und vielfältig. Schwer!!! Honig!!! Wenig Hopfen!!!! On Tap in der CRAFT BEER BAR Hannover.25cl/4,40Euro.

Bottle 35,5cl
@ XXXII The Great Power of Beer & Wine, Seville, Spain
A: Dark amber
T: Malt, caramel, raisin.
Bottle from Alko. Aroma has caramel, toffee, malt, dark bread. Taste is very nice and warm and has a lot of dark bread on it. Very good beer.

Butterscotch, jam, raisins, alcohol, a whiff of wet dog, light coffee, and caramel.
Ruby colour, medium beige head, lacing.
Heavy sweetness, medium bite, lightly salty. Malt forward, yet it packs a hop punch. More Than usual for the style, ABV well hidden.
Fullbodied, soft carbonation, oily feel, salty, sweet and warming finish.
Good example of an American take on the style.

Strong malty aroma, caramel, toffee, bread, raisin, smoke. 
Pours a slightly hazy reddish brown color with small off white head
Smoke more prevelant in flavor, woody, char, raisin, toffee. A bit bitter. 
Medium full body with medium low co2, lingering woody bitterness in finish.
Aroma smells great. The flavor is a bit bitter in my opinion. I like sweeter scotch ales. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at L’Europe, Madrid. Pours dark ruby, tan head. Intense aroma is blackberry, raspberry, red gummy, sundae caramel. Tasty, sweet-ish, powerful -to be sipped slowly. Long finish with little hop bitterness. Nice.
Draft. Pours dark brown with a tiny brownish-white head. Sweet malt, chocolate, alcohol. Medium sweet. Aroma and flavour go hand in hand.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown colour with a thin beige head, aroma is malty with some hints of toast, taste is medium bitterness with fruit with a dry fruit finish.
Pretty in a glass. Boozey caramel and peat, approaching a scotch flavor. One of my favorites, and the ABV packs a nice punch.

Bottle from Alko. Reddish brown with some brown head. Nutty, alcohol, some fizzy, sweet. strong with alcohol, need more complexity,

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

tap at Taphouse (Copenahgen) hazy brown and amber with a small white head. Roasted caramel malty aroma withfruity hops note. Fruity, light metallic, roasted caramel. Growing bitterness into a fruity flavoured finish.

355ml bottle from The Perfect Pour, Maryland. Pours a cloudy dark ruby with a yellow head. Aromas of chocolate, red wine, roast malt. Flavors are similar, sweet up front, with a good spicy bitter finish. Very creamy and boozy.
Очень необычное пиво, раскрывающееся в долгом и сложном карамельно-травяном послевкусии. Довольно питкое. Во вкусе и аромате присутствуют освежающие "овощные" нотки
Beer pours very dark brown almost black, head is on the tan side. Beer tastes really good going down definitely recommend
Pours a nice dark brown, almost black. Aromas of chocolate, with hints of nut and smoke. Flavor is a nice creamy chocolate with a bittersweet aftertaste. This is one hell of a beer.

This is a pretty good beer. It’s got a nice medium body with a nice creamy mouth feel. You can taste the malts in the beer, but it balances out for a nice overall taste, and it is a beautifully nice red amber with a nice white head.

Clear, intensely deep red colour with thick and creamy light brown head. Great aroma, plenty of malty sweetness, syrup, caramel and some toast. Pleasant taste, also has strong malty flavour, ends in a bit of hoppy bitterness. Mouthfeel is slick, oily, low in carbonation. Great tasting beer, very rich in flavour, highly enjoyable.

355ml bottle. Reddish/brown colour. Minimal carbonation and head in my bottle (BB 02/07/16). Aroma of cocoa, syrup, caramel. Taste very sweet with light bitterness and umami? I think it is present here in the aftertaste. The flavour is excellent, I suspect though that the stated ingredients are not the only ones in this brew.

Beer has a nice taste and aroma and the after taste is not that bad. Overall an okay beer but nothing special

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From notes: Bottle from Alko. Thick malty body, a bit sweet, alcohol and caramel flavor. Not much hoppiness, just a lot of malts, alcohol. Strong and complex.

BOTTLE 12 OZ. Clear ruby, beige head. The aroma is quite simple - caramel dominated, some malty and spicy notes. The taste is similar, with lots of caramel (but not at all sticky), a strong peppery bitterness with toasted bread notes. Just a touch of alcohol and a smooth easy drinking body. Nice, even though a bit too simple.

Malt, karamell, sötma, humle. Mörk röd öl med ett smutsvitt skum som länge lämnar rester i glaset. Riktigt trevlig öl!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear caramel brown, greasy bubbly thin head. Nose is big smoked brown sugar and oddly floral malt. Initial taste is a straightforward latch of tinny molasses, soft pepper and frozen choc. Carbonation is a formality and mouthfeel is clingy. Finishes a cooling gulp of soft roast, caramel brownie and lingers a brazen spicy sweetness. 

Never really telling of the ABV but never really gripping enough. Amazed I’ve not rated it before now.

Dark amber color with ruby hues, tan head. Aroma has sweet roasted malts, some dark fruits and a bit of booze. Taste starts sweet with caramel malt and cherries, a bit of roasted character and some hoppy bitterness on the finish. Medium body and carbonation, slightly boozy. Not bad but it’s a bit boozy for my taste and also the hops don’t really mix well with the sweet malts.

A dark red full-bodied ale, with a solid malty caramel aroma, and a malt and spicy hop flavour. Somewhat pungent taste, with medium sweetness and bitterness. Overall, a beautiful, smooth and well-balanced ale.

Aroma: Peanuts, Caramel & Hops
Appearance: Dark Golden Red.
Taste: Similar to the nose: Peanuts, Caramel, a Hops opening & Malt finish.. 
Palate: Minimal Carbonation, Silky Smooth.
Overall: Excellent example. A robust introduction and a silky smooth finish.

22 oz. draft at BW3. Medium dark reddish color, nice head. I could detect almost no aroma. Smooth taste, with a pleasant bitter finish. Good, but not great. Just not doing it for me...

Update: 12/12/2017 - Either my tastes have changed, or something was awry with the draft I originally rated.   This a really good beer.  There is a nice, rich sweet roasted aroma.  Rich malty body, with that roasted caramel present again.  Very little bitterness,and a lot of yum.

A pearler. Riding the veil between malt sweetness and just being way too sweet. Rich caramel nose with an initial sweetness rounded off my richness and gentle hops. Finishes with beautiful syrup notes. Awesomness!

DATE: April 15, 2016... OCCASION: a LONG week PARCC testing ends with a good beer to recharge me... GLASSWARE: Brew at the Zoo pint... APPEARANCE: dark velvet body holds a single-finger near-brown head that is creamy and resilient... lacing is spread in smears... love the half-finger head that remains throughout the drinking... AROMA: nice peat, smoke and leathery earthiness, combined with pear, raisin, cinnamon and ... PALATE: dry, bourbon-like draw with a subtly BIG, chewy strength... long, lingering finish... warming and surprisingly crunchy, suggesting hoppiness... TASTE: I just told my wife that this beer is "sinfully good"... and that is no lie, with its scotch approximation that brings raisin, grapes, peat and subtle smoke... a rich, complex,., sippable beer that is the pleasant accompaniment to an actual scotch... OVERALL: a fantastic, big, slowly draining beer that resonates with a malt-heavy finish...two bottles in, and the effects are staggering... strong, solid and another feather in Founders’ cap...
From 19 Mar 2016 -- just awesome malty goodness. The kind of beer you can sit down, relax, sip, and unwind to.

Look: dark red, clear, with stable beige head.

Aroma: malt, toffee, caramel, light smoky and turf notes.
Taste: moderate sweetness balanced with spicy bitterness.
Flavour: rum, caramel, baked pumpkin with caramel and warming spices.
Finish is less sweet and more bitter and spicy.

Very good.

Pours dark brown with light brown head. Aroma is light metallic, caramel, some candies, light grass. Taste is caramel, sourish, strong metal, copper, heavy grass, some ether. Quite nice refreshment, but some grass or medicine taste will leave you in the end. Otherwise, nice beer!

Draught at NYC Craft beer festival
brown, off white head.
aroma of caramel, 
taste sweet, bitter round feel. Slightly caramel.
nice
Poured from a bottle. Pours a deep mahogany brown with a thin off white ring. Aroma of toffee and light malts. Flavor is very Blah. Some woody, earthy notes but not much else? Very disappointing.
Bottle to chalice. Dark reddish amber pour, medium brown head . Caramel, alcohol, roasty, smoked aroma. Sweet burnt caramel, alcohol flavor. Medium-slick body. Sweet - burnt aftertaste.
Its pretty scotchy. Some traces of doughy barnyard basement aromas soaked in cooked vegetables and resin.
12oz bottle from The Real Ale Company. Dark orange brown, beige head. Sweet grain malt aroma. Sweet bovril flavour. Sickly sweet malty aftertaste. Not my sort of beer.

Superbe robe rousse, mousse crémeuse peu abondante. Nez puissant et complexe sur des notes fumées, épicées, lardées sur un fond de malt torréfié et de café au lait. Bouche à l’attaque fraîche, droite, nette, une très belle ampleur, de l’équilibre, une grande longueur et une finale sur une fine amertume. Une très belle bière équilibrée.

From 12oz bottle to snifter. Pour is a dark amber color, thick tan head. Nose is huge roasted malt, caramel, light booze. Taste is medium-heavy bodied, sweet with touches of sourness as well. Finishes strong on the palate. Nice beer, love the complexity here.

Pour is dark reddish amber, small tan head. Aroma of caramel, brown sugar, cherry, roasted nuts, spices. Very well balanced and rich yet refreshing. Sweet overall with good hop bitterness to balance. Fruity and malty with slight smoke and peat. Average carb. and med. to full body. Recommended.
not my personal favorite. strong alcohol taste, caramel aroma. light carbonation. average overall
Poured bottle into Teku. Dark brownish red with beige head. Aroma: butterscotch, cough drop, licorice, raisin. Flavor: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, like it. Overall good scotch.

355 ml bottle from our lovely monopoly. Pours hazy brown to dark amber with a tight small off-white head. Roasted caramel malty aroma with a distinct hops note, bit of wood notes. Fruity, light metallic, roasted caramel and prune flavoured. Balanced and tasty in all aspects.

355ml bottle at home. Dark brown, very small beige head. Aroma is roasted caramel malts, brown sugar... small bit of alcohol but its not disturbing. Full bodied. Taste is medium to heavy sweetness, light to medium bitterness.

A- pours a translucent ruddy amber with a loose khaki head hat thins quickly. No lacing. S- pungent caramel malts, toffee, peat, apple cider, blueberry juice, bubble gum, wet grass and sour wood. M- medium bitter and tacky body with low carb. T- lots of twigs, brown apples and caramel malts. Sharp grasses, soap and saccharine sugars. Wood and liquid smoke. Lots of zinc, lemon lime, and soda water.

Bottle@Salling, Aarhus. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma and taste is sweet malts, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, dried fruits and nuts, some spices. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Nice mouthfeel. Good light bitter finish.
Clear dark amber color with big medium beige head. Aroma is malt, dark fruits. Flavor is malt, roasted.
Bottle. Pours dark ruby with large beige head. Aroma is burnt caramel, wood, butterscotch and malts. Taste is sweet, burnt malts, char, popcorn, alcohol.

8.5%ABV. Scotch Ale.

Poured out dark brown amber. 18° SRM.

Nose. Roasted nuts and caramel. There are also aromas of port, flan, brandied cherries, rum raisin, Christmas cake or rum cake. There is also a rich and very pleasant spiciness to the nose with nutmeg and cinnamon. 

Palate is highly complex with sweet flavors of molasses, brown sugar, maple syrup, manuka honey predominating. There is a nice hop balance to this monster with flavors that are spicy representing Thai basil, cilantro and parsley. 

Overall, this one came onto the palate very much like Mike Myers’ character, brash, obvious, pushy, a little smelly and breathtakingly crude, but dig a little deeper and you find that it’s all just a cover for some very fine, genteel and almost painfully subtle sensory experiences. 

I loved this one so much I almost "feel a turtle head pokin’ out!"

Goes on Favorites List!

caramel sweetness with a bit of dry hops and alcohol. I was expecting something different. Maybe my nose is clogged up, but this beer isn’t really giving me anything too pleasant. Basic scotch ale with out anything special and a bit too heavy alcohol presence. (or maybe it’s just my faulty nose today).
Aroma of sweer malt, caramel and bread. Nice aroma. Taste is not very complex and its dominated by alcohol. A nice bitter ending.

Sweet, bread-like, with a little bitter at the end. I didn’t like it that much at first but the second time around was waaay better! The bitter finish seemed not so bitter and I evened the flavors much more.
Bottle. Pours dark amber thin tan head. Aroma of biscuit malt and caramel, bread. Medium-heavy sweetness. Medium body, somewhat metallic taste in finish. Good overall.

Dark reddish-brown with a big tan head, aromas of lightly burnt toffee, a hint of smoke and a touch of yeast. Rich and initially sweet, with a syrupy texture, then a dry bitterness cuts in, along with a toasty edge. Mid-body and finish are still sweet but with the alcohol and bitterness cutting away the cloying edge. More balanced than one might expect!
0,33 bottle. Pours hazy copper color with small off white head. Aroma of cherries, smoke, carameland roasted malts. Sweet in taste. Medium To full body and medium carbonation.
Strong sweet malty aroma. Brown and clear with a fine brown-white head. High sweetness and light-medium bitterness. Average soft carbonation. Medium-full body. Fine ale!

Dark brown color with tan head. Strong and sweet caramel aroma with toffee and alcohol. Taste has malts, herbs, raisins, toffee and alcohol. Full mouthfeel. Average carbonation. Well done and well balanced beer!
Bottle. Murky copper color, tan head. Chocolaty aroma. Resiny, syrupy flavor with medicinal alcohol and chocolaty notes. Very full body, medium carbonation. Not bad.
Pours very dark brown, with ample tan head. Aroma of malts. Taste is rich and malty, not too sweet. A good solid scotch ale, thumbs up.

Bottle. Strangely, I’ve never rated this til now... and it’s even stranger given that the BA version of this is one of my favorite annual treats. Anyhow, deep Amber-brownish pour, medium tan head. Nose is malty, candy sugar, maple, toffee, butterscotch, tobacco, fragrant wood. Mouth is medium bodied, sweetness giving over to bitterness and then to toasted oakiness, caramel, nutty, pumpernickel, raisins. Tasty brew. Sláinte.
Dark ruby color with light brown head. Aroma is caramel, vanilla and sweet malts. Taste is alcohol, dark fruits and toffee. Medium-full body, semi sweet and slightly bitter finish. Interesting beer.
Delicious Scotch ale. Looks great in a glass with a nice head that laces beautifully. Has a nice punch with ABV 8.5 yet easy to drink with a nice bit of sweet smoke flavor.
Bottle. Pours with plenty of short lasting head. Quite boozy with malty caramel toffee. Too much alchohol for my liking
Earthy and complex. Old world laid down fruits, dark caramel and prunes. A wonderful experience.

Caramel, roasty, alcohol, notes of chocolate, dark brown with red reflections, minimal and not persistant head, taste of tofee, dark fruits, medium sweetness bitter final with alcohol and warming sensation, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation...i want to taste another example of this style..maybe skull splitter..but good, i really appreciate.

Amber / brown color, hazy liquid and small head.
Aroma of caramel and old wood.
Taste is sweet and bitter.

Taste in glass from hand pump with almonds. Slight tan head. Dark Amber. No real aroma to me. Smooth tasting

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 Fl. Oz. Poured reddish brown, with a light brown head and some spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma of smoke, alcohol and caramel. Taste of dark fruit, malts, booze and caramel. Enjoyable, interesting, quite good.
Bottle 0,355. Dark ruby with a thick tan foam. Malty with aroma of raisin, toffe and wood. Medium full body with taste of caramel, chocolate and prune. Real delight!

35cl bottle. Clear dark ruby pour with a very small tan lacing. Smells of caramel and bourbon. Super smooth mouthfeel. Tastes like bourbon, caramel, toffee, very well balanced. An excellent scotch ale.
There’s just something about good Scotch ales...the caramelly toffee flavor, the smooth maltyness that fills your mouth, and the smokey, alcohol-tinged finish. This is definitely a good Scotch ale.
Massive and lingering light brown head under a extremely dark Amber body. Slick and smooth but not thick. Sweet with some alcohol bite at the end.

I don’t have too much experience with this style, but I recently enjoyed a few glasses of Orkney Skull Splitter on tap at the Foundry, and found that authentically Scottish Heavy Ale to be much preferable to this one. Poured a bottle of Dirty into a tall thin tulip and got some head. Reddish brown in color and smelling of darker malts, I drank it too cold at first and it was good, but lacking character, so I let it warm up for a while, and as it did, it fell apart into disparate components. It certainly is a complex mix of flavors, which aren’t Scottish and don’t really work well together. Pretty reminiscent of Lagunitas Brown Shugga with a bunch of extra things thrown in, smokiness, hoppiness, bitterness, molasses-ness, dark fruitiness and so on.

Bottle from Utobeer, London - UK. Color: deep dark brown beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt and caramel malt. Toffee, sweet domination, brown sugar. Small alcohol finish. Taste: full body with caramel and roasted caramel malt. Toffee domination. Alcohol taste. Boozy beer... Aftertaste: astringent alcohol taste with peat notes. Caramel and roasted malt. Very nice!
